If you are a Lead DevOps Engineer with 5+ years experience in a SysAdmin, DevOps, SRE or equivalent role? If so, please read on!

We have the least attrition of any company in the greater Los Angeles area and we offer an unparalleled culture on top of competitive pay, benefits and cutting edge technology. This role has the opportunity to be FULLY REMOTE.

This role will report to the Director of Platform Engineering, and will lead a growing team of high-performing engineers.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

1. We are digital data collection company that is setting a higher standard for data quality.
2. Our company is rapidly-growing and we just moved into a beautiful new office.
3. You will have the chance to work on exciting new development projects with a talented team.

What You Will Be Doing

-Report to the Director of Platform Engineering, lead a growing team of high-performing engineers
-Help define and enforce DevOps standards, procedures, and guidelines to improve the overall development process
-Provide technical leadership and guidance to both your team members and your peers
-Cultivate a modern DevOps culture and mindset throughout your teams and establish performance metrics and processes to improve velocity and deliverability
-Deploy and support high-performance, highly-available infrastructure on AWS
-Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning
-Conduct periodic on-call duties
-Own the day-to-day health, uptime, monitoring, and reliability of our cloud infrastructure
-Work closely with engineering and project management to develop tools and solutions
-Identify tactical issues and react to emerging areas of concern
-Identify unnecessary complexity and remove it

What You Need for this Position

-5+ years experience in an SRE/SysAdmin, DevOps, or equivalent role
-3+ years of production AWS experience, including but not limited to EC2, RDS, ElastiCache, S3, Auto Scale, ELB
-2+ years of experience in technical leadership role managing DevOps in Agile environments (Scrum)
-Capability to program in at least one language (other than Bash), ideally Python, PHP or Java
-Solid knowledge of the Linux architecture
-Experience with container stacks and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, ECS, etc)
-Experience with Configuration Management tools such as Puppet, Chef, Salt, or Ansible
-Experience with Infrastructure as a Code frameworks such as Terraform
-Experience with Microservices
-Experience with application monitoring tools (DataDog, New Relic, SumoLogic, etc)
-Strong knowledge of core protocols and tech such as TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, load balancers, distributed file systems, key-value and relational databases
-Excellent organizational skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced work environment
-Experience with CI/CD tools and production code deployments

What's In It for You

- Competitive Salary
- Health, Dental & Vision Insurance
- Flexible hours
- MacBook Pros
- Overall engaging and fun atmosphereSo, if you are a Lead DevOps Engineer, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=6, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
NOTE: U.S. Citizens, GC and those authorized to work in the U.S (without Sponsorship) are encouraged to apply.

We are unable to Consider OPT or H1B Visa Candidates for this position.

Key responsibilities:

Establish relationships with key decision makers in the customer organization in order to contribute to project details and outcomes.
Implement changes according to project governance.

Participate on a number of projects/programs, occasionally a role in the guiding of the project team.

Qualifications:

CCNA, CCNP (Preferred), Optionally BS Degree in engineering (IT, Telecom, Computer Science).

Preferably over 5 year's relevant experience

Strong interpersonal communication skills (written, spoken and presentation) and ability to work with clients/customers. Good understanding of networks and services.

Is pro-active, with good communication skills (written, spoken and presentation), creativity, problem solving and decision-making skills. Is capable of working both independently and within teams and be comfortable working in structured and unstructured situations and solving non-standard problems.

Evaluate site network infrastructure, and operations; assess customer current and future plans to optimize their network architecture, and capabilities.

Description:

Support existing Routing and Switching infrastructure including Cisco Nexus, 3750, 3560, 6500, 4500, and various other Cisco Switches and Routers

  • Install, configure, and support Cisco (Nexus 9K 7K 5K 3K) Switches
  • Install, configure, and support Cisco (3560, 2950, 6500, 4500) Switches
  • Install, configure, and support Cisco (2800, 2900, 2800, and 3900 series) Routers.
  • Engineer solutions to integrate Routing and Switches into new facilities.
  • Engineer solutions to update Routers and Switches into existing facilities.
  • Experience with Cisco Putty/Secure CRT.
  • Experience with SSH configuration and testing.
  • Work with outside vendors and internal organizations to have various surveys performed and required equipment installed.
  • Resolve client connectivity, interference, and other networking issues.
  • Writing Change documentation based on Standards documentation.
  • Performing Peer reviews of team members work to verify accuracy, wording, and functionality.
  • Providing Support after the change event
  • Troubleshoot routing/switching issues such as BGP, EIGRP, ACL's VLANs, VTP, and spanning tree issues.

Requirements:

  • Extensive knowledge on Cisco IOS Platforms and Cisco Systems products.
  • Experience performing LAN/WAN hardware infrastructure changes
  • Knowledge of ST, SC, and LC fiber optic technologies
  • Knowledge of LAN infrastructure to include Cisco Switches and Routers
  • Knowledge of LAN switch configuration technologies to include VTP, STP, QoS, and Cisco switch stack configurations
  • Knowledge of Routing Protocols and Routing Redistribution
  • In-depth understanding of troubleshooting Cisco router and switch configurations.
  • Ability to interface directly with vendors and local support teams regarding WAN/LAN hardware implementation
  • Ability to self-manage concurrently running projects.
  • Ability to follow Change Management Processes
  • Ability to work during nights, weekends, and during the daytime
  • Experience with Arista Devices and WAAS devices is a plus.
  • Availability to work US working hours so they can attend customer project meetings
  • Availability to work weekends for deployments and implementations.

Contact: Pradeep

- provided by Dice

items.title: Operations Assistant
items.content:
Operations Assistant at Hirsh Marketing

Remote

NORTH AMERICAN APPLICANTS ONLY!

Hirsh Marketing is looking for a rockstar Operations Assistant who can bring passion and innovation to our growing team of digital brilliance!

Who we are
Hirsh Marketing is one of the fastest-growing digital marketing companies in North America, with clients from the US, Canada, South Africa, Malaysia, Great Britain, Australia and others all over the world.

Our team is fully remote and highly dedicated to delivering the very best experience for our clients of industry leaders, influencers and entrepreneurs in their respective niches.

The ideal candidate has:

  • 2+ years of administrative assistant experience, preferably in a remote setting
  • Familiarity with the online business space
  • Systems and process-oriented, with extreme attention to detail
  • Excellent written, verbal, and virtual communication skills
  • Aptitude and desire for continuous learning
  • Ability to multitask in a dynamic environment
  • Ability to take initiative, recognize departmental gaps and offer suggestions for improvements

Job Responsibilities:

  • Assist Operations Manager with all employee on-boarding and off-boarding duties, ensuring that all team members are operating at their highest levels.
  • Own and execute micro experiences for all Hirsh team members (i.e. special personal events, significant milestones, morale-boosting gestures).
  • Organize all-new team member gifts
  • Manage our job applicant inbox and own all correspondence (i.e. sorting through resumes, responding to applicants and queries
  • Schedule and conduct screening interviews for both Internal & Ads Team positions
  • Coordinate and schedule skillset assessments for candidates
  • Coordinate and schedule final interviews for candidates and the relevant management team
  • Fully on-board all new team members
  • Grant new team members with access to all relevant Hirsh Marketing resources
  • Conduct onboarding check-ins with all new hires to ensure each new team member is set up for success
  • Schedule team member monthly self-assessments with direct reports
  • Execute routine audits of our HR software to guarantee all employee data is accurate and up to date
  • Create and update employee and contractor agreements with Operation Manager’s oversight
  • Promptly Off-board team members within a specified time frame
  • Consistently organize and update HR Team Google Drive to secure sensitive information and easily access team member assets
  • Work closely with Operations Manager to ensure all People functions are operating seamlessly

Awesome perks:

  • 100% remote
  • Paid training leading to a competitive annual salary
  • Paid sick leave (dependent on state)
  • 2 weeks of PTO
  • $150/mo health stipend after one month of employment
  • Annual team retreats
  • Paid holidays (New Years, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day, and Christmas Day)

Team environment with an organization fostering a people-first culture

Apply for job

items.title: DevOps / SRE at Platform.sh
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=8, other=20, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=1, go=11, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=42, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
DevOps / SRE

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: DevOps, System Administrator
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Continuous Delivery, PaaS
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Platform.sh | No office location

Technologies

python
symfony2
azure

Job description

Mission 

Platform.sh is a groundbreaking hosting and development tool for web applications. We’re a European VC-Backed startup with a host of blue-chip Enterprise clients and a string of awards and grants (including €2m from the EU Horizon 2020 program).

To reinforce our technical prowess, we are looking to grow our operations team in the US and in the APAC timezones. If you’re looking for an exciting, high-growth opportunity with an award-winning, cutting-edge company, this could be just the job for you

For its PaaS solution https://platform.sh is looking for an Operations and Service Reliability Engineer with a taste for Python and Go, great Linux system understanding, and a real hunger for the challenges of building robust, distributed systems.

Platform.sh is a PaaS shrouded in a lot of black magic (we can consistently clone a whole running cluster, with its state, databases, indexes in a matter of seconds). We want to get this down to the hundreds of milliseconds domain. Interested? There is more...

Our external API is pure Hypermedia REST + oAuth on top of Pyramid. It mechanizes the Git layer and needs more features.

We can consistently generate from the same manifest a Docker container, an LXC one, or VM disk images (AWS, Azure, OpenStack), we want more targets.

We probably have the highest industry container density. We need to get it higher.

We support any Python, Ruby, NodeJS or PHP, Java and .NET, time to roll-out Elixir, of course, Elixir (and Rust. We need Rust).

In close interaction with our Engineering and Customer Support teams, you will be responsible for:

  • cloud operations: configure clusters, deploy stuff, follow-up on alerts, help customer support debug issues.
  • automating all of the above so they can instead drink margaritas (or non-alcoholic beverages, of course)
  • creating systems, tools & processes that will enhance our support and operations efficiency
  • improving service quality, discipline and reliability throughout lifecycle
  • monitoring operating objectives, streamline and automate intervention
  • continuous learning from Operations experience, modeled as software


The ideal candidate

  • has proven successful experience in an operations role,
  • has demonstrated the ability to successfully manage cloud-based infrastructure for a fast growing organization,
  • has experience with containerization technologies,
  • has had exposure to cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP, ...),
  • understands how an OS works, knows networking, how git works, and the constraints of a distributed system,
  • Puppet experience,
  • is proficient in Python (Golang a plus)
  • is based either in Americas or APAC timezones.

Nice to have 

  • knowledge of Magento Ecommerce, Symfony, Drupal, eZ Platform, or Typo3.

Note: we don't like stress, so we build everything to be robust and resilient, but stuff does break. This is a role with on-call duties and fire drills. If this fills you with dread... well, this might not be a fit for you.
 

Apply now

About Platform.sh

Platform.sh is an idea-to-cloud application platform that simplifies cloud infrastructures.

We give developers the tools they need to experiment, innovate, get rapid feedback and deliver better-quality features with speed and confidence thanks to our unique rapid cloning technology.

Platform.sh serves thousands of customers worldwide including The Financial Times, Gap, Magento Commerce, Orange, Hachette, Ikea, Stanford University, Harvard University, The British Council, and Lufthansa.

We want people who are passionate, open, multicultural, friendly, humble and smart to join us and help this fast-growing, award-winning company to revolutionize the tech industry.

Benefits

  • Work from home, wherever you are
  • Safe and friendly working environment
  • Stock options for everyone
  • Rest and recovery are essential to health and happiness; we get that

Expanding access toaffordable, high quality health care starts here. This is where some of themost innovative ideas in health care are created every day. This is where boldpeople with big ideas are writing the next chapter in health care. This is theplace to do your life's best work.(sm)


This creative roleoffers an excellent opportunity to directly impact an innovative function andsecure your future with an industry leader. The Senior Network PricingConsultant supports and validates physician incentive / performance basedcontracting activities through financial and network pricing modeling,analysis, and reporting. The individual in this role will travel to provider locationsin the assigned territory to present / discuss financials, as well asthe data points that explain the financial results.





PrimaryResponsibilities:

  • Develop, monitor and evolve the payment incentive model
  • Work independently and interact with external constituencies
  • Provide data analysis, contract auditing and metrics reporting to management
  • Perform reconciliations to determine if physicians have met contractual obligations
  • Translate highly complex concepts in ways that can be understood by a variety of audiences
  • Advocate for best economics internally and externally
  • Develop, analyze and monitor new, routine and ad hoc reports
  • Predict emerging customer needs and develop innovative solutions to meet them
  • Solve unique and complex problems with broad impact on the business
  • Develop and manage business plans to achieve objectives
  • Influence senior leadership to adopt new ideas, products, and / or approaches
  • NOTE: Travel to Providers in Northeast is a requirement
  • Role is office based in CT, RI



Required Qualifications:
  • Bachelor-s degree or higher
  • 4+ years of analytical experience in financial analysis, healthcare pricing, network management, healthcare economics, or related discipline
  • 4+ years of experience with provider payment methodologies and healthcare products
  • Advanced level of proficiency in performing financial impact analysis, risk management, and data manipulation
  • 4+ years of experience in creating and using financial modeling tools, spreadsheets, and information acquisition tools including experience in interpreting and reviewing financial modeling results to evaluate the financial impact of contract changes and develop forecasts
  • Advanced level proficiency in MS Excel
  • Client facing experience
  • Must live within commutable distance of one of the office locations listed in the job posting. These locations area CT, RI


PreferredQualifications:

  • Experience with relational databases (Oracle, SQL Server, SAS)
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • ACO Experience


Careers at UnitedHealthcare Employer &Individual. We all want to make adifference with the work we do. Sometimes we're presented with an opportunityto make a difference on a scale we couldn't imagine. Here, you get thatopportunity every day. As a member of one of our elite teams, you'll providethe ideas and solutions that help nearly 25 million customers live healthierlives. You'll help write the next chapter in the history of health care. Andyou'll find a wealth of open doors and career paths that will take you as faras you want to go. Go further. This is your life's best work.(sm)


*All Telecommuters willbe required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group-s Telecommuter Policy.



Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is anEqual Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and all qualifiedapplicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disabilitystatus, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status,genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.


UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates arerequired to pass a drug test before beginning employment.



Job Keywords: HealthcareEconomics, Network Pricing, Medical Economics, Healthcare Analyst, FinancialAnalyst, Sales Contracts Analyst, Pricing Consultant, Shelton, CT, Hartford,CT, Trumbull, CT, Connecticut, RI, Rhode Island

items.title: Senior Systems Engineer--End User Compute--Open Location / Remote
items.content:
RoundTower is a premier systems integrator that provides innovative solutions and services in the areas of data center infrastructure, converged platforms, mobility, cloud automation and orchestration, DevOps, and data analytics. RoundTower is helping enable its customers to drive positive business outcomes by becoming more agile and efficient through the use of technology. We are currently looking for an experienced Senior Engineer to join our End User Computing & Mobility practice. The Senior Engineer (EUC) is a senior-level role capable of supporting all phases of the End User Computing methodology from Assessments, Designs, Implementation, Transitional Support, and Optimization.

Responsibilities

  • Direct delivery ownership of assigned End User Computing engagements including design, implementation, and support.
  • Create as-built documentation and provide knowledge transfer to customers upon completion of installation and configuration
  • Drive the continuous improvements of our Practice Methodology and Service Offerings based on client experiences.
  • Maintain up-to-date industry certifications specific to areas of practice and as required to maintain Vendor/VAR status.
  • Manage multiple engagements simultaneously in conjunction with other Practice Engineers while ensuring proper collaboration and hand-off as needed.
  • Evaluate and foster new partner products and solution capabilities within the Cloud & DevOps practice portfolio.
  • Assist with delivery readiness and training for Cloud & DevOps offerings.
  • Willingness to travel.

Capabilities:

  • Ability to perform advanced, independent design and implementation of Citrix and VMware End User Computing solutions such as Citrix XenDesktop/XenApp, XenMobile, and NetScaler as well as VMware Horizon View and AirWatch.
  • Develop and propose solutions around VDI, Application Virtualization, Enterprise Mobility Management, Enterprise File Sync & Share, and complementary solutions that provide the highest value for our customers while taking into account their unique business, functional, and technical requirements.

.
Experience/Certifications:

  • Experience consulting, designing, architecting, implementing, and supporting either Citrix or VMware End User Computing solutions with 4+ years of industry experience.
  • Strong technical background in End User Computing and Mobility solutions, including: Desktop Virtualization, Application Virtualization, User Environment Management, Enterprise Software Deployment, Enterprise Mobility Management, and Enterprise File Sync & Share.
  • Experience with the following End User Computing solutions preferred: Citrix, VMware, AirWatch, Unidesk, Liquidware Labs, RES, and AppSense.
  • Experience with the following Application Delivery Controllers preferred: Citrix NetScaler and F5.

Qualifications

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills, and the ability to communicate security and risk-related concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences.
  • Exhibit excellent problem solving and analytical skills, the ability to manage multiple projects under strict timelines, as well as the ability to work well in a demanding, dynamic environment and meet overall objectives.
  • High level of personal integrity, as well as the ability to professionally handle confidential matters, and show an appropriate level of judgment and maturity.
  • High degree of initiative, dependability and ability to work with little supervision.
  • Ability to analyze and interpret performance data in order to provide assessments and presentation solutions derived from empirical data and customer business requirements.
  • Translate complex business requirements into business proposals.
  • Develop overall virtualization solutions including high level designs, Statements of Work, and creating bills of materials.


Education

  • BS/BA (EE/CS) or equivalent experience
- provided by Dice

AWS, Heroku, SALT, Ansible, Terraform, Postgres, Python, RUBY, Bash, RabbitMQ

If you are a DevOps / Site Reliability Engineer with experience, please read on!

We're located in sunny Southern California however we're looking for an experienced DevOps candidate to join our team - we allow 100% remote!! We're a technology/health company that is bridging the gap with user data to determine health behavior and needs. We received our Series C funding and we're ready to ramp up our team and product.

We offer great benefits including health, dental, and vision for your and your dependents; we also offer a relaxed and flexible work environment to accommodate any of the hiccups that life throws your way. Applications are reviewed and processed quickly - please apply today if you are interested.

**Application will be considered incomplete unless screening questions are answered; incomplete applications cannot be submitted for further review. Please answer all screening questions in detail in order to expedite the process.**

What You Will Be Doing

- Solving complex technical problems
- Working on product architecture and scalability of distributed systems
- Architect, develop & deploy the operation of our systems
- Ensure proper health and security of our systems & data
- Some on-call experience, distributed among the DevOps team
- Creating scalable pipelines for cost-effectiveness and security

What You Need for this Position

At Least 3 Years of experience and the following:

- Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or similar area of study
- Strong experience working in a Linux environment
- Previous experience in a DevOps culture
- Use of configuration management & automation tools (Chef, Puppet, Ansible)
- Working in the cloud (AWS is a big plus!)
- RDBMS experience (Postgres, MySQL)
- Messaging/queing systems (RabbitMQ, SQS, Kinesis)

What's In It for You

- Vacation/PTO
- Medical
- Dental
- Vision
- Team events
- Lunches
- 100% RemoteSo, if you are a DevOps / Site Reliability Engineer (100% Remote) with experience, please apply today!

items.content:
Thycotic

Devops Support Escalation Engineer


The DevOps Support Escalation Engineer – Tier III is a key member of the Thycotic Technical Support Global Escalation Team. This individual will support multiple DevOps & Cloud products and work closely with team experts from the Development and Cloud operations departments to solve highly escalated issues for the worldwide support team. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, are required to interact effectively with our worldwide customers and internal stakeholders.

This position will report to the Global Escalation Manager and ideally be based in our DC office; however strong remote candidates may be considered.  

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


* Analyze escalated customer issues and provide solutions to address their needs including debugging, troubleshooting and owning all escalated issues until a resolution is provided

* Communicate highly technical and complex issues with internal and external stakeholders

* Work closely with the rest of the Escalation Team members to meet SLA and customer requirements

* Provide team mentoring and product leadership

* Create technical content for team and customer use




REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS


* Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or other related field a must

* 5+ years of software consulting, customer service, and/or support experience required

* Prior DevOps experience

* Familiarity with some of these open source technologies: Jenkins, Kubernetes, Docker/Containers etc.

* Proficiency with a scripting language such as PowerShell, Bash, Python, or Ruby

* Familiarity with configuration management tools like Ansible, Chef, or Puppet (prior working experience a big plus)

* Knowledge of Cloud technologies (Azure, AWS) a must

* Ability to identify and communicate product gaps, resource/tooling gaps, and documentation gaps so they can be addressed

* Excellent interpersonal, verbal (English) communication, written and presentation skills required

* Ability to work independently and as part of a team

* Ability to work with team members from different cultures and other regions

* Highly motivated, “can do” attitude that adapts well under pressure

* Ability to work on-call weekend rotations and some holidays





Thycotic is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, ancestry, national origin, color, religion, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.

Upon conditional offer of employment, candidates are required to complete a criminal background check and drug screen per Thycotic employment policy. In addition, all publicly posted social media sites may be reviewed.

items.title: DevOps Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=2, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=28, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Interpersonal Frequency

Devops Engineer


We are looking for a DevOps engineer to help us scale our systems as we bring more cities and government agencies into the cloud. Our backend tech stack currently includes RHEL/CentOS, Docker, Node.js, PHP, Apache/Nginx, Solr/ElasticSearch, MariaDB/MySQL, GlusterFS, Redis/Memcache, HAProxy, Varnish, New Relic, and AWS (GovCloud, EC2, ELB, RDS, Aurora, ElastiCache, S3, CloudFormation, Redshift, EFS, etc.), DigitalOcean, and Rackspace.

Who you are 

We're looking for a DevOps engineer with significant experience configuring, managing, automating, securing, monitoring and maintaining systems at scale.

- You love to solve problems and can do so under pressure. 

- Scaling, reliability, automation, security, and performance are things you care about deeply. 

- You have a good mixture of planning, risk taking and a “get-it-done” attitude. 

- You value the open source community and want to give back to it. 

- You can clearly explain your ideas to both clients and other team members both verbally and in writing. 

- You like to have fun and work with a small team! You play well with others (not just engineers). 

- You bring both creativity and maturity to your work: you’re a self-starter who can jump in quickly and can manage your own time effectively in a remote work environment.

What you’ll do 

You will help ensure the scalability, security, performance, and availability of our systems by applying your expertise in the evolution and daily operation of our LAMP/LEMP stack, implementing and automating infrastructure deployments and working with our engineering team to ensure the software that we build can scale.

Requirements

- You must either be a US Citizen or already have a Green Card to apply

- 3-5 years of experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud hosting

- 3+ years of experience with MySQL (DevOps, not DBA)

- Linux - Nginx and/or Apache

- Varnish

- PHP (DevOps tuning, not dev)

- Docker

- Shell scripting

- Ansible / Chef / Puppet

- Code repository versioning (Git)

Bonus Skills

- Memcached/Redis

- CentOS/Redhat Linux

- HAProxy

- MariaDB/MySQL Clustering

- Elasticsearch and/or Apache Solr

- Code repository hosting (e.g. Gitlab)

- Drupal Optimization

- Big Data (e.g. Hadoop, Redshift)

- Authentication Integration (e.g. LDAP/AD/SAML)

- Penetration testing

- Load testing

- GlusterFS

- Performance testing (e.g. New Relic, Blackfire)

- Jenkins

Why work with us?

- Fun, cutting edge remote work environment – ever changing, always a chat away from team members

- Your work directly impacts the lives of millions of Americans every day

- Healthcare, and Dental/Vision/Life/Disability plans

- Unlimited vacation, and a flexible schedule

- Work in a mostly virtual environment or a coworking location. If you work virtually, be prepared to travel once per quarter for face-to-face with the team

If you are interested, please send your cover letter, resume, and some code samples or examples of past work to [email protected]

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: DevOps
Industry: E-Commerce, Marketing Automation, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private

Remote details

docker

rancher
gitlab-ci
linux

Job description

Standort: Lindau, Dortmund oder Remote

Wir sind ein sympathisches Team mit Büros in Lindau am Bodensee, Dortmund und Freiburg im Breisgau. Mit professionellen PIM-Systemen wie Viamedici EPIM, Contentserv und OpusCapita sowie Open-Source-Software wie Symfony, eZ Platform, Sylius, Solr, Gitlab, Docker, Rancher erstellen wir anspruchsvolle, cloudbasierte e-Commerce- und Omnichannel-Lösungen für Industrie und Handel.
Wir haben Spaß daran, uns neue Technologien zu erschließen – und damit Lösungen zu schaffen, auf die wir stolz sind! Unsere Projekte sind so groß, dass wir im Team daran arbeiten, bleiben aber immer überschaubar. So treffen wir auch Entscheidungen: schnell, einfach und gemeinsam.

Mehr zu uns auf facebook

Das erwartet dich

  • Schnittstellenfunktion zwischen der IT Infrastruktur und Softwareentwicklung
  • Erweiterung unserer Continuous Integration und Deployment-Prozesse
  • Administration und fachliche Verantwortung für unsere Tools: Rancher in Verbindung mit Docker und GitLab-Runners, sowie GitLab, SonarQube, Solr-Admin, Adminer, Sentry
  • Unterstützung der Teams in Projekten mit den containerbasierten Umgebung (Docker, Docker-Compose, GitLab-CI)

Das bringst du mit

  • Fundiertes Wissen und Erfahrungen mit Docker, Docker-Compose und Rancher
  • Praktische Erfahrungen in Build- und Integrations-Tools (GitLab-CI, GitLab-Runners oder Jenkins) 
  • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Linux sowie auch Shell und YAML
  • Erfahrungen im Betrieb von Web- & Application-Servern in Cloud-Technologien
  • Idealerweise das Vorstehende für PHP Symfony Anwendungen
  • Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Deine Persönlichkeit zeichnet aus

  • Spaß an der Teamarbeit
  • Sehr gute Problemlösungskompetenz
  • Hoher Qualitätsanspruch

Unser Angebot

  • Mitarbeit in einem multinationalen, professionellen Team
  • Lösungen mit technologischem High-End-Anspruch
  • Individuelle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten in strukturiertem Personalentwicklungsrahmen
  • Attraktives Vergütungsmodell
  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge
  • Reizvoller Arbeitsplatz in Lindau direkt am Bodensee oder in Dortmund im Industriedenkmal in Citynähe - oder remote im Homeoffice

Noch nicht ganz überzeugt? Weitere Informationen zum Thema "Mitspielen im infolox-Team“ findest du unter www.infolox.de/mitarbeiter

Deine Bewerbung

Wir freuen uns auf deine vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen mit Gehaltsvorstellung und möglichem Starttermin.

Bei Fragen einfach fragen!

Dein Ansprechpartner

Gunnar Fuelle
mitspielen@infolox.de

Apply now

items.content:
At Chattermill we use cutting-edge AI technology to give leading companies the key to improving their customer experience. We work with many of the most exciting companies in the world (Uber, HelloFresh, Transferwise, Skyscanner, and Deliveroo to name a few!) and are passionate about helping them put their customers’ at the heart of their decision making.

In four short years, we’ve grown from two co-founders to a team of 40 (and counting) bright and diverse individuals. We have big plans and are now looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join our Engineering team in Berlin to ensure the stability and scalability of our platform.

*As a Site Reliability Engineer, you will:*

* Conduct an in-depth audit of our current infrastructure
* Help us to define and execute a plan for migration of our k8s cluster from bare metal to managed k8s in the cloud (our preference is GKE)
* Take active part at all stages of our engineering process from design and implementation to support and maintenance.
* Help colleagues from different teams (software engineers, data scientists) to setup the right infrastructure for their workloads
* Provide expertise and guidance to build self-healing system with high availability and horizontal scalability
* Ensure the health of all environments by monitoring technical and business metrics, setting up alerts for things going wrong, acting proactively to prevent disasters, acting fast and effectively when they happen
* Be the driver of our incident management process, apply root cause analysis in investigation of incidents with other engineers and help to define preventive measures to exclude the whole class of identified issues
* Improve our CI/CD pipelines based on CircleCI which involves but not limited to improving speed of our builds and tests, firing up prod-like test environments to run our e2e tests, canary releases with automatic rollback based on metrics
* Play a proactive role in identifying performance bottlenecks and other architectural issues and provide guidance on how to mitigate them in a planned and timely manner
* Take an active role in redesign of our data pipeline to build new version that facilitates agile experimentation for our Data Science team and enables even more complex data integration with our clients

*What we’re looking for:*

* Extensive experience managing production k8s clusters with data-intensive workloads in the cloud (GKE, AWS)
* Experience in complex infrastructure migrations of mission critical systems with zero downtime
* Operational experience with databases in our stack (Postgres, Redis, ElasticSearch).
* Proficiency in more than one programming language (including Go) and ability to identify and automate routine repetitive tasks
* A strong architectural background in distributed systems
* Experience in setting up central logging on ELK stack
* Experience in managing highly available Prometheus (with Thanos), setting up alerts with Prometheus’s Alertmanager, creating dashboards in Grafana
* The ability to define SLA and provide a viable plan how to stay stick to it
Experience setting up RabbitMQ and/or Kafka
* An understanding of infrastructure as code principle and experience in its successful application with tools like Terraform
* The ability to explain OSI model and to diagnose and debug network issues in a cloud environment
* Deep knowledge of Linux and the ability to explain how it works under the hood
* Good communication skills, interest in building effective relationships with colleagues
* An interest in providing a cutting-edge infrastructure, ability to assess new technologies, evaluate maintenance costs of different alternatives, prove their viability, willingness to facilitate adoption of new solutions within the team

*Nice to have:*

* Experience working as a Backend Engineer
* Experience in setting up data infrastructure for AI-companies

*Why join us?*

* A competitive salary and stock options
* Great progression opportunities - we want you to grow with us!
* 25 days holiday (in addition to public holidays)
* A big focus on personal development including a €550 development budget and biweekly Breakfast and Learns
* Flexible working conditions and the opportunity to work from home
* Central office location with free Barista coffee
* Quarterly Company Socials planned by our great colleagues!

items.content:
Cyber Systems Engineer – Omaha

United States, Nebraska
Company: Peraton

Overview

Overview
Peraton is seeking a senior cyber security engineer in Omaha, Nebraska with thorough understanding of the DoD Risk Management Framework (RMF) per DoDI 8510.01 and the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800 series set of documents.

Responsibilities
What you’ll do…

  • Lead a team evaluating “end-to-end” systems and subsystems from a cyber security perspective. Conduct research and evaluate technical performance and cyber vulnerabilities.
  • Ensure components and systems comply with requirements and government information assurance and cyber security standards and practices through formal verification methods.
  • Verify and validate components and systems with specific emphasis on network operations and cyber security tactics, techniques, and procedures focused on the threats to information networks.
  • Assess component and system performance using evaluation criteria and technical performance measures. Prepare assessments and cyber threat profiles based on testing, research, and analysis.
  • Participate in design reviews of components and systems (hardware and software) to ensure applicability to the system and traceability of cyber requirements.
  • Review test plans/procedures and ensure they verify/validate cyber requirements. Develop and maintain analytical procedures to meet changing requirements.
  • Produce high-quality papers, presentations, recommendations, and findings for senior US government and operations officials.
  • DOD security Hardening
  • Collection and assessment tools (STIGs, VMS/SCAP, Nessus, etc.)
  • Security Architectures
  • Boundary and network devices (firewalls, routers, switches, etc.)
  • Identify, assess, and validate baseline security controls (BCS)
  • Prepare Plan of Action & Milestone (PoA&Ms) to document and mitigate cybersecurity deficiencies.
Qualifications
You’d be a great fit if…

  • You have a Bachelor of Science undergraduate degree
  • You possess a DoD 8570 Certification Information Assurance Technical (IAT) Level II minimum
  • You are proficient with MS Office suite

It would be even better if you…

  • Have a Master’s degree in engineering, cyber, or STEM area
  • Have knowledge of SEI CMMI DEV 1.3 Level 3 processes
  • Possess knowledge of Atlassian tool suite
  • Have knowledge and use of eMASS
  • Crrently have an active DoD Secret Security Clearance

What you’ll get…

  • An immediately-vested 401(K) with employer matching
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Tuition assistance, financing, and refinancing
  • Company-paid infertility treatments
  • Cross-training and professional development opportunities
  • Influence major initiatives
About Peraton
Are you ready to join the next-generation of national security? Peraton is a fresh name in the industry with an established portfolio and legacy going back more than a century. We work differently than our peers – with agility, the freedom to innovate, an entrepreneurial spirit and a culture of responsibility. As part of the Peraton team, you’ll be part of our movement to build a great company, solve the most daunting challenges facing mankind today, to protect and promote freedom around the world, and to secure our future, for our families, our communities, our nation, and our way of life.

EEO Statement
We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Systems Engineer – Navy Programs (Active Top Secret)

United States, Washington DC
Company: Peraton

Overview

Overview
We are seeking a Mid to Senior Level Systems Engineer to support our US Navy customer Strategic Systems Programs, in Washington, DC with Weapon Systems Acquisition.

In this position you will support SSP’s nuclear weapon fuze modernization efforts and assist SSP with Nuclear Weapons Council (NWC) Action Officer (AO) support. The company has held this contract for over sixty years and is working on the fourth year of a five year Re-Entry System Technical Support Contract. Offices are located near the Washington Navy Yard within sight of the Nation’s Capital and with easy access to public transportation (Green line on the Metro).

Responsibilities
What you will do….

  • Writing technical white papers, preparing presentations
  • Track, status, and, as necessary, coordinate responses to actions assigned by the NWC and NWC SSC to Navy SSP as well as those assigned in other meetings
  • Assist Navy SSP with reviewing and providing coordinated comments to Presidential and Congressional level reports.
  • Serving as technical secretary for various DoD/DOE working groups
  • Analyzing and tracing requirements
  • Reviewing and commenting on detailed test plans and reports
  • Analyzing detailed schedules in support of EVMS
  • Assessing the design and production efforts of the Design and Production Agents
  • Serving as independent evaluator for formal design development, integration, qualification, and production reviews
  • Interface with SSP, Joint Staff, DTRA, Army, Navy, DOE (NNSA), OSD, and contractor personnel.
  • Representing the Navy customer at various meetings when they cannot be present
Qualifications
You would be a great fit if…

  • You have a BS in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Nuclear Engineering, Systems Engineering, Physics or Chemistry, and 8+ years of directly related Systems Engineering experience; or a MS degree and 6+ years of experience; without a degree 14+ years of experience is required
  • You can demonstrate 8+ years of experience in a related Systems Engineering role
  • You have an active Top Secret security clearance and can maintain the clearance.

It would be even better if you…

  • Have 5+ years of experience in the development of a major weapons system or experience with Navy littoral combat ship systems
  • Have knowledge of DOE processes for nuclear weapons development
  • Possess a MS degree in a related Engineering discipline
  • Have experience with DOORS
  • Have the ability to work independently
  • Possess strong communication skills
  • Have excellent teamwork

SECURITY CLEARANCE
This position requires the candidate to already have an active and current Top Secret security clearance and to maintain that security clearance.

What you’ll get…

  • An immediately-vested 401(K) with employer matching
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Tuition assistance, financing, and refinancing
  • Company-paid infertility treatments
  • Cross-training and professional development opportunities
  • Influence major initiatives
About Peraton
Are you ready to join the next-generation of national security? Peraton is a fresh name in the industry with an established portfolio and legacy going back more than a century. We work differently than our peers – with agility, the freedom to innovate, an entrepreneurial spirit and a culture of responsibility. As part of the Peraton team, you’ll be part of our movement to build a great company, solve the most daunting challenges facing mankind today, to protect and promote freedom around the world, and to secure our future, for our families, our communities, our nation, and our way of life.

EEO Statement
We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law.

items.content:
Senior Systems Engineer – Welcome

United States, Maryland
Company: Peraton

Overview

Overview
Peraton has an immediate need for a Senior Systems Engineer who will join our team at Blossom Point Tracking Facility (BPTF) in Welcome, MD. You’ll be a part of the technical team that will assist with, and sometimes lead, the integration of new missions into the baseline, planning system upgrades, resolving issues and adding new capabilities to the infrastructure.

Responsibilities
What you’ll do…

  • The Systems Engineer shall be a part of the technical team that will assist with, and sometimes lead, the integration of new missions into the baseline, planning system upgrades, resolving issues and adding new capabilities to the infrastructure.
  • Will use standard requirements definition processes for new and/or expanded projects
  • Will identify and manage risks on new and existing projects
  • Will conduct trades studies on new technologies for ground system architecture
  • Create and update wiring diagrams, flow charts, and other documentation
  • Trouble shoot and coordinate repairs for any ground system issues
  • Use test equipment such as Oscilloscope or Spectrum Analyzer
  • Partner with Cyber Team to ensure network security regulations are met
  • Assist RF Technical Team w/upgrades and troubleshooting of large apeture antennas
Qualifications

You’d be a great fit if you have…

  • A Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent) in Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, or related field.
  • 10 years of relevant work experience.
  • 5 years experience with satellite command and control systems.
  • Satellite/spacecraft ground systems knowledge including RF, radio frequency, digital signal, etc.
  • 3 years experience with cryptographic equipment and networks such as KG7, KG17, KG777.
  • An active Secret security clearance.
  • The ability to obtain a TS/SCI security clearance.

It’d be even better if you…

  • Have experience with Ground/Earth Station environments.
  • Understanding of RF Design principles
  • Component level troubleshooting and replacement
  • Windows/Linux System Administration knowledge
  • Understanding of network topologies

What you’ll get…

  • An immediately-vested 401(K) with employer matching
  • Rapid PTO accrual schedule with floating holidays
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Tuition assistance, financing, and refinancing
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave
  • Company-paid infertility treatments
  • Cross-training and professional development opportunities
  • The ability to influence major initiatives

SECURITY CLEARANCE
This position requires the candidate to have an ac tive Secret security clearance and must be able to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI clearance.

About Peraton
Are you ready to join the next-generation of national security? Peraton is a fresh name in the industry with an established portfolio and legacy going back more than a century. We work differently than our peers – with agility, the freedom to innovate, an entrepreneurial spirit and a culture of responsibility. As part of the Peraton team, you’ll be part of our movement to build a great company, solve the most daunting challenges facing mankind today, to protect and promote freedom around the world, and to secure our future, for our families, our communities, our nation, and our way of life.

EEO Statement

We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law.

items.content:
Senior Systems Engineer – Herndon

United States, Virginia
Company: Peraton

Overview

Overview
Peraton is seeking a Senior Systems Engineer to join our team to support classified projects based in Herndon, VA. As part of the systems engineering team you will design, integration, test, delivery, and support phases of multiple inter-related contracts that transform customers’ enterprise-wide, globally deployed, data storage and dissemination services.

Responsibilities
What you’ll do…

  • Support Systems Engineering Subject Matter Expert (SME) on Peraton’s solutions and services.
  • Provide oral and written communications for customer-facing events to include weekly updates, quarterly reviews, contract milestones, proposals, ad hoc issue resolution, field deployments and technical roadmaps.
  • Develop internal documentation such as architectural system block diagrams, recommended components, vendors and technical solutions.
  • Help supervise, train and mentor junior engineers. Help determine shortfalls, develop training plans, drive process improvement, provide technical guidance to achieve programmatic goals and root cause analysis events.
  • Provide hands-on training to internal team members and external customers. Develop SOPs and train team members accordingly.
  • Provide quality assurance of all program deliverables the Systems Engineering team is responsible for as per contractual and team requirements. Includes technical requirements derivation, CONOPs recommendations, architectural system diagrams, system technical specifications, configuration and operation guides, system sparing plans, deployment plans, detailed system and component drawings, logistical system details, root cause analysis reports, and field deployment reports.
  • Plan, resource, and schedule fielding activities to include sub-contractor and vendor coordination and logistical pre-deployment shipments
  • Coordinate and prepare in-brief/out-brief meetings, prepare and submit daily reports, resolve ad hoc deployment issues, develop punchlists and resolution plans
  • Provide training and guidance to the on-site field support representative .
Qualifications

You’d be a great fit if…

  • Bachelor’s Degree in systems engineering or a related technical field and 5+ years of relevant experience.
  • 5+ years of relevant experience in the system engineering life cycle including requirements analysis and documentation, specification development, system design, concept of operations development, and interface control document development.
  • 5+ years of relevant experience with hardware/software testing and requirement verification

It’d be even better if you…

  • Have experience maintaining factory test equipment and environment in support of the Test team and Software team development needs
  • Are comfortable ensuring factory systems are capable of mirroring deployed system and planned system designs and configurations. Planned and scheduled configuration changes and system updates.

What you’ll get…

  • An immediately-vested 401(K) with employer matching
  • Rapid PTO accrual schedule with floating holidays
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Tuition assistance, financing, and refinancing
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave
  • Company-paid infertility treatments
  • Cross-training and professional development opportunities
  • The ability to influence major initiatives

SECURITY CLEARANCE
This position requires the candidate to hold an active TS-SCI security clearance, and to maintain this clearance.

About Peraton
Are you ready to join the next-generation of national security? Peraton is a fresh name in the industry with an established portfolio and legacy going back more than a century. We work differently than our peers – with agility, the freedom to innovate, an entrepreneurial spirit and a culture of responsibility. As part of the Peraton team, you’ll be part of our movement to build a great company, solve the most daunting challenges facing mankind today, to protect and promote freedom around the world, and to secure our future, for our families, our communities, our nation, and our way of life.

EEO Statement
We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote Operation Specialist Landing.work

Company: Landing.jobs
Location: Lisbon, PT
Remote location: Fully remote
Level: Intermediate
Language: Portuguese
Product/Project Management
Skills:
  • Customer Support
  • Recruitment

    • Intro

    Landing’s mission is to reshape the future of work by transforming the way career development and hiring work. As a step on the journey, we’ve just launched the alpha version of a new product that we’re calling Landing.work.

    We’ve launched Landing.work to help solve some of the challenges tech professionals face when working remotely as contractors, which are two growing trends. Landing.work will help tech professionals benefit from all the advantages of working as a Contractor such as getting higher pay, choosing their own clients and setting their own rates.

    Our plan for the first months is to roll-out Landing.work for contractors based in Portugal and learn a lot from the process. Being part of this team means you are going to help and evaluate contractors during the evaluation process. You will also support our Operations team to guarantee that we are providing the best service possible.

    What you will be doing

    • Support and evaluate the contractors going through the evaluation funnel;
    • Understand what are our contractors’ likes and dislikes about the process;
    • Help improving things like CV and Landing.work’s profile;
    • Give support during the matching process, including rate counselling, career development opportunities and others;
    • Match client projects with the best contractors available;
    • Share useful information about companies and job openings;


     This is a remote position which means that you can work from wherever you want (as long as you manage 5+ hours of common working time with the remaining team). However, with freedom comes responsibility - this means your work will be measured by the results you present.

    Main requirements

    • 2+ years of experience working in fast-paced environments;
    • (Plus) Experience in account manager and recruitment;
    • Accountability and ownership of your own responsibilities;
    • You must be a people’s person and someone really communicative;
    • Data-driven mindset and solution-oriented;
    • Positive and proactive attitude, always aiming for more;
    • Fluent in Portuguese and English;
    • Multi-tasking ability.


    Nice to have

    • Passionate about the HR/Recruiting Tech industry.

    Perks

    • You can work from wherever you want (as long as you manage 5+ hours of common working time with the remaining team);
    • (Optional) 2-3 days per month at the Landing office;
    • Training and resources available so you continuously improve yourself;
    • A commission model that is designed to ignite you.

items.content:
DevOps Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: DevOps, System Administrator
Industry: Government, Libraries, Web Hosting
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Interpersonal Frequency | No office location

Technologies

mysql
php
amazon-web-services
docker
varnish
sysadmin

Job description

We are looking for a DevOps engineer to help us scale our systems as we bring more cities and government agencies into the cloud. Our backend tech stack currently includes RHEL/CentOS, Docker, Node.js, PHP, Apache/Nginx, Solr/ElasticSearch, MariaDB/MySQL, GlusterFS, Redis/Memcache, HAProxy, Varnish, New Relic, and AWS (GovCloud, EC2, ELB, RDS, Aurora, ElastiCache, S3, CloudFormation, Redshift, EFS, etc.), DigitalOcean, and Rackspace.

Who you are 

We're looking for a DevOps engineer with significant experience configuring, managing, automating, securing, monitoring and maintaining systems at scale.

- You love to solve problems and can do so under pressure. 

- Scaling, reliability, automation, security, and performance are things you care about deeply. 

- You have a good mixture of planning, risk taking and a “get-it-done” attitude. 

- You value the open source community and want to give back to it. 

- You can clearly explain your ideas to both clients and other team members both verbally and in writing. 

- You like to have fun and work with a small team! You play well with others (not just engineers). 

- You bring both creativity and maturity to your work: you’re a self-starter who can jump in quickly and can manage your own time effectively in a remote work environment.

What you’ll do 

You will help ensure the scalability, security, performance, and availability of our systems by applying your expertise in the evolution and daily operation of our LAMP/LEMP stack, implementing and automating infrastructure deployments and working with our engineering team to ensure the software that we build can scale.

Requirements

- You must either be a US Citizen or already have a Green Card to apply

- 3-5 years of experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud hosting

- 3+ years of experience with MySQL (DevOps, not DBA)

- Linux - Nginx and/or Apache

- Varnish

- PHP (DevOps tuning, not dev)

- Docker

- Shell scripting

- Ansible / Chef / Puppet

- Code repository versioning (Git)

Bonus Skills

- Memcached/Redis

- CentOS/Redhat Linux

- HAProxy

- MariaDB/MySQL Clustering

- Elasticsearch and/or Apache Solr

- Code repository hosting (e.g. Gitlab)

- Drupal Optimization

- Big Data (e.g. Hadoop, Redshift)

- Authentication Integration (e.g. LDAP/AD/SAML)

- Penetration testing

- Load testing

- GlusterFS

- Performance testing (e.g. New Relic, Blackfire)

- Jenkins

Why work with us?

- Fun, cutting edge remote work environment – ever changing, always a chat away from team members

- Your work directly impacts the lives of millions of Americans every day

- Healthcare, and Dental/Vision/Life/Disability plans

- Unlimited vacation, and a flexible schedule

- Work in a mostly virtual environment or a coworking location. If you work virtually, be prepared to travel once per quarter for face-to-face with the team

If you are interested, please send your cover letter, resume, and some code samples or examples of past work to devopsjobs@ifsight.com.

Apply now

About Interpersonal Frequency

At I.F., we’re putting the government in the cloud. We design, build, maintain, and grow sites on our open source, highly available web stack for some of the largest cities, public libraries, and government agencies in the country. Our company’s purpose is to make government online more relevant, accountable, and responsive to everyone. We also created a suite of proprietary analytics tools that survey 3.4 million Americans each day. We are growing quickly and are looking for engineers to continue to deliver cutting-edge, open sourced websites for our clients.

I.F. is a 10 year-old company with team members in Seattle, Chicago, Denver, New York, and the DC area, among others.

We provide a remote work environment, so you don’t need to move for this job. We encourage face to face collaboration in our regional offices and expect you to travel when required. As a purpose and principles-driven organization, we want talented team members who want to make a difference.

Working remotely means we can bring together some of the best minds in the country. Between video calls and Slack, the distance evaporates quickly, and ideas, projects and puns fly at the speed of light. Working remotely also allows us to find harmony in work / life balance. 

Benefits

  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Access to training's and conferences in your field
  • 401(k) available by the end of this year
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Three competitive medical plans to chose from
  • Dental and vision plans
  • Long and short term disability insurance
  • Employer paid life insurance

items.content:
Senior DevOps Engineer (Europe, Remote)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: DevOps
Industry: Software Consulting, Software Development / Engineering, Web Technology
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: NearForm | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+00:00) London +/- 4 hours

Technologies

ansible
amazon-web-services
terraform
kubernetes
continuous-integration
Osmond van Hemert Full Stack Mobile and Web Developer 74 3
jh3y I love making awesome things for awesome people! 1.3k 6 9
Filippo De Santis 12 2
Matt Harrison JS/Rust developer and author based in the UK 11k 6 32 54

Job description

What your day looks like

You get home from the gym, you like to get there early to avoid the rush hour and it gets your energy levels up for the day. Turn on your monitor and join the hangout for your daily standup. There are some GitHub pull requests that need your attention, time to put your Ansible hat on. Lunchtime - you go and meet some friends at your favourite cafe. When you get back to your desk, your Terraform environment has finished provisioning and you kick off some smoke tests. Then it’s back to your earlier automation work. Before you know it, it’s time to close the laptop. 

What you’ll be doing

At NearForm, we work with international clients who are industry leaders in their respective fields. Our role is to help them build solutions and platforms; help them to launch new product ventures and fundamentally change how they operate.

Join a highly skilled multidisciplinary team; typically consisting of designers, front-end and back-end experts, DevOps engineers, and also members of the client team. This mix follows a modern agile development methodology where we run 2-week sprints with a defined backlog, daily standups, weekly demos, sprint planning and sprint retros; all with as little ceremony as necessary.

What we ask of you

  • 6+ years experience developing at an enterprise level
  • An ability to perform well in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent analytical and multitasking skills
  • Located in Europe
  • Availability for short-term travel on a semi-regular basis
  • Fluent English and outstanding communication skills (written and oral)
  • Modern DevOps mindset using best of breed open source tools and technologies, for example, Terraform and Ansible
  • Management and automation experience of real-world platforms/applications on AWS
  • Experience working with Azure is desirable
  • Continuous integration - building continuous delivery pipelines
  • Experience working with containers and container orchestration must include Kubernetes
  • Security awareness throughout the stack
  • Data storage experience with RDBMS and NoSQL technologies

What will you get?

  • Work/Life balance: we have a genuine dedication to work/life balance.
  • Family-friendly: we understand how important family is, so our flexible environment allows you to work around what matters - school run, no problem!
  • The Wellness Hub: we offer resources and support and have a genuine commitment to fostering/improving nearFormer’s wellbeing.
  • Knowledge perks: explore new hobbies, brush up on life skills or simply learn something new, there is something there for everyone.
  • NearFest: we all get together in person at our annual company retreat

Why do you want to join the team?

We adopt a person-first approach to hiring. That means we hire the best people – it’s as simple as that. Our lucky HR team gets to pick the cream of the crop from around the world and has brought together a collection of dynamic and talented individuals we like to call ‘NearFormers’.

Although we are widely dispersed, NearFormers are a tightly-knit team. We trust one another and care about our colleagues. Building on our open-source origins, we promote the sharing of thoughts, knowledge and ideas.

NearForm is committed to shaping a better world in all that we do. Our global team is built based on respect, inclusivity, diversity and excellence.

Apply now

About NearForm

At nearForm we work with international clients who are industry leaders in their respective fields. Our role is to help them build solutions and platforms; help them to launch new product ventures and fundamentally change how they operate.

We have been developing complex solutions for global organisations since 2011. Our team of more than 120 exceptional people, distributed throughout the world, build better software faster.

From high intensity digital transformations, to delivering fullstack cloud-native web applications, our pragmatic agile approach is not just proven but is constantly evolving.

By delivering world-class design coupled with world-class development, we have fundamentally changed customers' expectations of what's possible.

We work in highly skilled multidisciplinary teams; typically consisting of designers, front-end and back-end experts, a delivery architect, devops engineers, and also members of the client team. This mix follows a modern agile development methodology where we run 2 week sprints with a defined backlog, daily standups, weekly demos, sprint planning and sprint retros; all with as little ceremony as necessary.

Benefits

  • Best People: we hire the best people from all over the world
  • Open Source: we aim to make significant contributions to Open Source
  • Work/Life Balance: we have a genuine commitment to work-life balance
  • Flexible: we support a schedule that fits your style
  • Family-Friendly: we offer parental and maternity leave, flexible hours
  • Location: join us at HQ and go for a surf at lunch time
  • Work Remotely: you don't have to be at HQ, work wherever suits you
  • The Wellness Hub: we offer resources and support for your wellbeing

items.content:
AWS DevOps Engineer- REMOTE

Job description:

We are looking for an AWS Software Engineer. We are looking for a motivated individual with strong analytical skills to lead AWS programming.

Benefits:
  • $401k with company match.
  • Company provided pension plan
  • Family medical and dental care coverage
  • Generous vacation and paid holidays.
  • Sick Days.
  • NO TRAVEL
Job responsibilities:
  • Continually improve DevOps processes and procedures.
  • Develop and maintain Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery systems.
  • Deploy automation solutions in a public cloud environment such as AWS.
  • Participate in ongoing design, implementation, and maintenance of systems and tools across our cloud stack.
  • Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
Requirements:
  • Strong knowledge on AWS.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong analytic and problem-solving skills.
For all inquiries about this position, please contact Christopher Gyedu at (646)-4 or [Click Here to Email Your Resum?]

Jefferson Frank is a leader in Niche IT Recruitment with a focus on AWS cloud technologies. We deal with AWS partners & End Users throughout North America. items.content:
AWS DevOps Automation Engineer- Remote- $120,000-$140,000
We are looking for top performers in software development and systems operations with AWS DevOps to go above and beyond, those who are hungry to expand their knowledge and contribute to new ideas pertaining to engineering autonomy. Our AWS premier consulting company assists enterprises with finding the services they need to develop fundamentally secure services for faster and more consistent software and infrastructure deployments. Our goal is to provide our customers with the flexibility to be in charge of their own software to increase product functionality.

WHY WORK FOR US? BECAUSE WITH US YOU CAN:
  • Work remote
  • Receive unlimited PTO
  • Flexible schedules
  • Continuous learning opportunities
  • Become a part of a large distributed remote team
WORK LIFE BALANCE
We understand the importance of a work-life balance, which is why we allow our employees to work anywhere with available internet connection. Outside of any core working hours, you could be working from home, the beach, outer space or a co-working space. We value your career goals, as well as our customer's goals, and are happy to allow employees an unlimited amount of PTO. Employees are part of a large distributed remote team. In order to insure you'll never feel alone, we provide employees the tools to stay in touch and collaborate with colleagues, whether that's through simple meetings or a pair programming exercise.

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Employ industry leading Continuous Delivery patterns and collaboratively work with other members to execute them to achieve successful continuous delivery solutions.
  • Collaboratively work with Senior DevOps Automation Engineers
  • You are required to travel to client locations and deliver DevOps consulting services when
    needed
  • AWS certified preferred but not required
REQUIREMENTS
  • 2-5+ years of technical experience in either development, operations, or full-stack implementations
  • At least 1-2 years of demonstrated programming capability in a high-level programming language such as Ruby, Python, Java, C# or other language Flexible schedules
  • 0-2 years successful customer engagements providing continuous delivery solutions, preferably employing AWS
  • 0-2 years of demonstrated Linux or Windows command-line capability
  • Familiar with core suite of AWS Services related to DevOps, with particular depth in those that are heavily used when providing DevOps Automation solutions, including the Management and Deployment services such as AWS CloudFormation, OpsWorks and IAM
  • Experience establishing and employing Continuous Integration practices and tools such as Jenkins or other CI tools
  • Frequent and comfortable use of configuration management automation tools such as Chef (or other such tools) in creating continuous delivery systems
  • AWS Certified Associate (Solutions Architect, Sys Ops, Developer). If you do not already have one or more AWS certifications, we focus on achieving that during your first 100 days on the job.
For all inquiries about this position, please contact Kayla Lozano at or [Click Here to Email Your Resum?]

Come work for the fastest growing Microsoft Gold partner in Austin! You would be working with the most cutting edge technology to enhance their Azure platform. They are expanding rapidly and need you to become a vital member to their software development team. This is an exciting time to jump in with a modern company that is focused on remote work, exciting projects, and a chance to learn and develop your skill set. New learning opportunities would be provided, as well as certifications paid for.
What would your day-to-day look like?
On a daily basis, you would be?
  • Leveraging your background in the Azure Cloud platform; this includes working with applications, microservices, APIs, and software development
  • Collaborating with a team of developers and senior leaders to put the Azure platform in place and develop out new software
  • Working on application deployments, automation, and building out the Azure platform in general
  • Keeping on top of the latest technology trends and Azure evolutions, to drive innovation within companies you work with
This company has a lot of benefits of working for them, including:
  • Remote flex work
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Pet friendly office
  • Snacks galore!
  • Great 401(k) matching
  • Friday morning breakfasts
  • Great benefits (healthcare, dental, life, vision, pet)
  • Gym membership reimbursement program
  • Tuition reimbursement program
Some of the skills they are looking for include:
  • 2 years of Azure experience
  • You have worked with containers (Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Azure PaaS experience - API apps, applications, API management, Restful API, microservices, web apps, etc.
  • Familiarity with scripting languages (.NET, C#, Java, Python, Powershell)
  • Leadership and communication skills
In order to fast-track your opportunity, please reach out to me ASAP to talk more about this role! The company is looking to fill the position soon and it will not be on the market long. Please note, this is a permanent role. Candidates for this position must be either US citizens or Green Card holders; Visa sponsorship is not provided. My contact information can be found below.
