items.title: Senior Technology Leadership Professional Automation Anywhere (remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Description

The Senior Technology Leadership Professional for Automation Anywhere is responsible for all aspects of software or hardware product delivery and performance. The Senior Technology Leadership Professional work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.


Responsibilities



The Senior Technology Leadership Professional oversees the technical implementation of the Automation Anywhere (AA) platform at Humana. He or she installs, upgrades, and maintains AA infrastructure, including Control Room, Bot Insights, and IQ Bot on a cloud platform and oversees the certification and deployment of AA client versions. The AA architect works closely with the corporate identity and access management team to implement security processes and protocols for AA. She or he provides top-level support for AA technical problems encountered by all stakeholders. The AA architect works closely with the AA vendor to identify and maintain a list of desired AA enhancements and drive implementation of those enhancements. The AA architect defines processes and procedures for AA development, both for citizen developer (business) teams and IT teams, and creates documentation. He or she integrates AA with other RPA and cognitive tools and other IT resources.

Responsibilities:

  • Infrastructure
    • Install, upgrade, and maintain Automation Anywhere infrastructure on Amazon Web Services.
    • Coordinate certification and deployment of the AA client.
    • Draft AA hardware plans and budgets.
    • Collaborate with other IT teams to obtain cloud resources, server backups, DNS entries, certificates, disaster recovery, etc.
    • Oversee implementation of Automation Anywhere on Citrix XenApp.
    • Develop AA integrations with corporate DevOps tools including code scanning and test automation tools.
    • Perform change management and provide system notifications for infrastructure changes.
  • Security
    • Work with the corporate identity and access management (IAM) team to develop processes and procedures for Automation Anywhere security provisioning.
    • Develop integrations with corporate IAM tools.
    • Provision and manage system accounts, groups, shared mailboxes, and distribution lists needed for AA operations.
  • Support
    • Provide third-level support for Automation Anywhere problems and issues.
    • Liaise support tickets with Automation Anywhere support.
    • Serve as a top-level resource for other RPA application architects, AA trainers, AA security team, AA IT developers, AA citizen developers, AA code reviewers, AA production systems management team, and other stakeholders.
    • Implement AA monitoring tools.
  • Vendor Relations
    • Maintain desired Automation Anywhere enhancements list and drive enhancements with the vendor.
    • Liaise with firms providing Automation Anywhere consultation to Humana.
    • Support business process outsourcing organizations who use the internal AA platform.
  • Process and Procedure
    • Define procedures for bot, credential, locker, role, user, and license administration.
    • Define the activities, artifacts, and approvals needed for the AA software development lifecycle (SDLC) for both citizen developer (CD) teams and the IT RPA team.
    • Define AA development standards.
    • Write documentation for CD teams and IT RPA team.
  • IT Integration
    • Integrate AA with other RPA and cognitive tools.
    • Integrate AA with other IT resources through database queries, ETL jobs, service calls, and other integration tools.



Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree
  • 5+ years of technical experience
  • Experience with the technologies in use in the application(s) or infrastructure
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate and communicate effectively across varying levels of personnel
  • Experience with unit testing and mocking
  • Strong proficiency in verbal and written communication.
  • Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Preferred Qualifications
  • Conceptual understanding of UI-interaction technologies such as WinAPI, MSAA, Java Access Bridge, DOM, EHLLAPI, etc.
  • Proven results in working with vendors to enhance commercial applications.
  • MBA or other Advanced Degree
  • Demonstrated ability running large scale projects
  • Experience with technology solutions assessments and/or strategy planning oversight
  • AA platform-level certification such as -Control Room Administrator- or -IT Infra Administrator.-
  • Experience with Cloud Platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
  • Experience with Puppet.
  • Experience with DynaTrace OneAgent.
  • Experience with Active Directory.
  • Experience with version control tools - Git, SVN
  • Experience with both relational and NoSQL databases including data modelling, data description language (DDL), and stored procedure development.
  • Experience with developing APIs and service calls, using both SOAP and REST.
  • Understanding of iterative development methodologies and terminology such as DevOps, Squads, and Agile.


Additional Information


Scheduled Weekly Hours

40
- provided by Dice

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
Description

The Senior Cloud Services Engineer enables cloud to provide optimal performance, continuity and efficiency in virtualized, on-demand environments. The Senior Cloud Services Engineer work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.


Responsibilities



The Senior Cloud Engineer works with the architecture team to build, maintain and support cloud computing environments. Assesses the compatibility and integration of products/services proposed as standards in order to build and integrate interdependent technologies. Builds on moderately complex to complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed with minimal supervision. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.

We are seeking a Senior Cloud Engineer with experience working in a complex computing environment to join our Cloud Engineering team. As a Senior Engineer you will work as part of a team that builds and supports Humana-s next generation internal and external cloud infrastructure. A thorough understanding of and working experience with an Enterprise computing infrastructure and cloud computing technologies are required. To be successful you will need a strong technical orientation; be a creative problem solver; be motivated to advance in the field; and work well in a team-oriented environment.

Job Responsibilities

  • Design, build and deploy Cloud solutions across Humana-s Azure tenant
  • Build automation of infrastructure as a Service and capabilities including virtual networks, virtual machines, cloud services, web sites, data services, IOT, etc.
  • Build, enhance, orchestration and automation of cloud enablement tools
  • Design a highly scalable and redundant virtual infrastructure to support the company-s future growth
  • Provide innovative suggestions for complex implementation solutions
  • Create documentation and implementation plans to allow support teams to build and manage the internal cloud environment
  • Be part of the Support rotation that will manage and maintain the Azure Infrastructure



Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related technical field required
  • 5-8 years experience in technology
  • 1+ years of Azure or Cloud experience designing and supporting large scale environments
  • 1+ yrs working in Scrum/Agile environment
  • 3+ yrs development experience
  • 3+ years of hands on experience supporting Enterprise computing infrastructure, Solid architecture & design experience in using virtualization technologies
  • Established experience with automated, elastic scaling of cloud services, automated deployment and remediation
  • Ability to prioritize projects and deliverables
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to work collaboratively as well as independently to support deadlines
  • Demonstrate ability to use problem solving techniques such as root cause analysis to resolve issues
  • Demonstrate ability to write and present effective materials, including presentations, status reporting, technical diagrams and flowcharts
  • Ability to follow and adhere to policies, procedures and standards relating to network and systems management
  • Prepare detailed build/test plans to implement new technologies and configurations
  • Ability to collaborate with a team working across multiple locations



Preferred Qualifications
  • Azure Certification is strongly preferred
  • A track record of success developing and deploying creative technical solutions to business problems for or within large enterprise organizations
  • Bachelor-s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field
  • Experience with the design and development of cloud-native, secure, distributed applications
  • Knowledge with modern service hosting, security, and risk management concerns such as IAM, access control, monitoring, IaaS/PaaS/SaaS, and containers
  • Knowledge of infrastructure automation through DevOps scripting and configuration management
  • Working knowledge of designing high availability systems in the cloud (fault domains, availability zones, deployment slots, regions)
  • Experience developing ARM Templates, Cloud formation templates, or Terraform
  • Networking fundamentals, including VPN, security, and WAN concepts
  • Experience using Source Control (GIt, TFVC, etc.)
  • Experience with infrastructure Configuration tools (DSC, Puppet or Chef)
  • Knowledge of Cloud Database fundamentals (Azure SQL, MS SQL)
  • Experience working in an agile continuous delivery workflow & team
  • Experience communicating technical complexity and change to a broad spectrum of stakeholders
  • Experience with technical writing and documentation


Scheduled Weekly Hours

40
- provided by Dice

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=24, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
VMWare, XenServer, Amazon EC2 Public Cloud, Apache Cloud, Stack Private Cloud, Windows Servers, Linux Servers, Server Operating Systems, Automation

If you are a Systems Administrator looking for a solid position where you will work from a home, please read on! This position supports our internal systems and our SaaS Service. We offer a number of different opportunities to improve your skills and experience! We also deploy models and technologies that many engineers are very excited to be working with!!

We are using VMWare, XenServer, Amazon EC2 Public Cloud, Apache Cloud, Stack Private Cloud, Windows and Linux Servers. As your skills evolve and develop over time there will be advancing technologies to learn and become productive on.

This role will be done remotely, but we do need you to be local to Southern California.

In this role, you will manage, patch and upgrade systems infrastructure, and work within a Security and Compliance controlled environment. We are looking for a Systems Administrator who is comfortable in working with Data Center Hardware and Software Systems.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

1. Opportunity to work for an international company, looking to expand their US presence
2. Job growth, customer facing, highly technical and innovative position
3. INCREDIBLE benefits and perks

What You Will Be Doing

- Installing and configuring new Server Operating Systems and Applications, according to best practice and company guidelines
- Monitoring and repairing Server Operating Systems and Applications
- Performing Patch upgrades on Server Operating Systems and Applications
- Maintaining Service Availability Targets
- Maintaining Service Confidentiality and Integrity
- Working with Engineers diagnosing and resolving issues in our production environment
- Learning technologies to improve yourself and the capabilities of the Team
- Looking for ways to improve the service availability and recovery times
- Working on an On-Call Rota for out of Hours Cover
- Working on designated tasks outside normal working hours as required by the role
- Visiting Data Centers for installation, configuration and maintenance of computer hardware

What You Need for this Position

- BS/MS in technical field with 3-6 years of work experience
- Perform Linux and Windows installations and configurations on these environments without help
- You must be comfortable using a Virtualized Environment such as XenServer or VMWare
- Have basic network knowledge of TCPIP, DNS, DHCP and VLANS, what they mean and their practical uses
- You must have a good working knowledge of configuring and using Monitoring Systems We use Zabbix and CloudWatch
- Understand the basic principles of ITIL, including Change Management, Problem Management and Incident Management
- Tackle technical problem that we are facing in our Application and Infrastructure stack and restore service accordingly
- Must have experience installing and maintaining server hardware, including racking, disk swapping and component replacement
- Experience operating in a compliance and security monitored environment, we operate PCI DSS, SOC2, HIPAA and ISO 27001

What's In It for You

- Vacation/PTO
- Medical
- Dental
- Vision
- Bonus
- 401k
- Many more perks!So, if you are a Systems Administrator with all of the experience we are seeking, please apply today!!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

items.content:

AWS, Lambda, OWASP tools for penetration testing, Terraform, Ansible, Cloud Formation, Java, Scala, NIST Security guidelines

Job Title: Senior 'DevSecOps' Engineer
Job Location: Menlo Park, CA or REMOTE
Salary Range: 150k-200k DOE + Equity
Required Skills: AWS, Lambda, Terraform, penetration testing, security
Nice To Have Skills: Blockchain/Cryptocurrency experience, Spark/Ignite

Based in Menlo Park, CA - We are a well-funded, revolutionary Blockahin/Cryptocurrency security startup paving the way for cryptocurrency, crypto asset & blockchain intelligence, analytics & compliance. We provide blockchain analytics & intelligence for financial investigations, anti-money laundering, counter-terrorist financing, verification of funds, audit and compliance. We received our 2nd round of funding last month ($15M ) and need to scale our engineering team!

What You Will Be Doing

- Enabling engineering team to deply product features
- Develop & maintain CI/CD features
- Build highly scalable disributed systems on AWS
- Penetration Testing

What You Need for this Position

- BS or MS Degree in Computer Science highly preferred (not required)
- 3+ years of experience deploying highly scalable distributed systems on AWS
- Ability to write a Lambda function
- Programming experience with one of the following: Scala, Java, C/C++, Go
- DNS & Networking
- NIST security guidelines

BONUS experience:
- Passion for blockchain/cryptocurrency
- Apache Spark/Ignite

What's In It for You

- 100% REMOTE
- GREAT starting salary + benefits + 401k + PTO + EquitySo, if you are a Senior DevOps Engineer with experience, please apply today!

items.title: Telecom Network Planning Engineer-Remote/ Telecommute
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=8, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
We are looking for Telecom Network Planning Engineer - Remote / Telecommute for our client in Matawan, NJ Job Title: Telecom Network Planning Engineer - Remote / Telecommute Job Location: Matawan, NJ Job Type: Contract Due to the nature of the assignment, Only US Citizens or Green Card Holders may apply Job Description: Major Activities:
  • Data Cleanse Network Element Equipment (Transport and IP equipment) reconcile Inventory Records with Equipment Logical circuits
  • Remove stranded cross-connects from equipment
  • Update Inventory circuit designs and Disconnect 0% Utilized circuits
  • Capacity augmentation and ring configuration completed by Service Provider team
  • Coordinate equipment ready dates with telecommunications services provider team Project Management
  • Migration planning is based on Turn Over Package (TOP) developed by telecommunications services Mid-Range Planner (MRP)
  • Resolve any (Turn Over Package) TOP gaps with the MRP(Mid-Range Planner)
  • Extensive knowledge of a wide variety of network equipment/ network layers is required
  • Develop Migration Circuit Plan (Transport and IP circuits)
  • Include existing A to Z circuit path
  • Identify the point to turn each circuit in the existing network path
  • Identify new equipment path from the turn point to equipment at the core site
  • Prepare design update and circuit groom cut sheets
  • Create design update NetBuilds (Revelation 1) attach cut sheets and Tactical Project Management submits NetBuild (Revelation 2)
  • Resolve any Java Embedded Object Production System that arises during the planning process
Requisite Skills / Work Experience:
  • Shall be familiar with various technologies in Transmission / IP Network, DWDM, Optical Transport Network (OTN) and SDH
  • 7 to 8 years of relevant experience in Telecom Sector and hands-on experience
  • Good Knowledge about network traffic planning and migration of Transport and IP network
  • Desirable Knowledge and exposure of Multi-vendor Transmission / DWDM/ IP (Router and Switches) products
  • Should be able to write small scripts/ macros to improve the efficiency
  • Should have strong Microsoft Office experience/knowledge
Equipment / Product Experience (Preferable from below set of Equipment s / Products):
  • DCS Coriant 5500, 532L, NGX, Alcatel Lucent 1630, 1631, 1633, DACS II, DACS IV, ECS1, CS1L, TDAX, TURIN Access Navigator
  • SONET Transport Alcatel Lucent DMX, Lambda Unite, FT2000, DDM, 1680, 1603, Cisco 15454, 15600, 15310, Ciena 5410, 5430 Core Director, Nortel S/DMS OC48, OC192, NTDX, NEC 2400, Hitachi 4100, 5192, Fujitsu 4500, 2400, 150, 600, Adtran MX280.
  • Metro/ Long Haul DWDM Tellabs 7100, Adva (FSP3000-RE7), Infinera (DTN), Alcatel (1830), Lucent (WES, OLS 400G, 800G), Ciena (4200, K2), Cisco (15800), Ekinops (C200, C600), Hitachi (AMN 6100), Huawei (OSN3600), NEC (Spectral Wave 16), Nortel (LH 1600/DT), Movaz (Ray Express)
  • IP (Routers and Switches) - Tellabs 88xx, Cisco (ASRs (9001, 9010, 920-24SZ, 4SZ), ME3600, ME3400, 1924, 2811, 2911, 2960, 3550, 3750, 4506, 5300, 5505, 5509, 6503, 6506, 6509, 7206, 7206, 7507, 7609, 10008, 12410, 12416, 4900M), Juniper (M40, M120, M160, M320, MX240, MX480, MX960, T640, 5100, 4300, EX Series, QFX Series), Foundry: Networks Bigiron 4000 Ethernet Switch, Fastiron X-Series Switch, SuperX Switch, MLX-32, NETIRON XMR 16000, Alcatel (7710 , 7750, OS6850, PE300), Overture (5008-930, 5122-930, 5260-930, 5262-930, 5410-015, ISG 140, ISG 180, ISG 2200, ISG 5000, ISG 5100, 1400)

items.title: Juniper Network Engineer II - REMOTE
items.content:
Juniper Consultant

Location: Lincolnshire, IL

Selling Point:

This project does not start until (July end) will last for 6 months to 1 year. Must be Juniper JNCIE-DC certified. This is a support and troubleshooting role not an architect role. NSX is a plus would prefer local to drive in to meeting 2 times a month but open to remote with 10% travel.

We have a project with a client who owns two very large Juniper Data Centers. We need a resource for 6 months to a year that can assist with the daily support the Juniper Network infrastructure as the client migrates from NSX-V into NSX-t (NSX is out of the scope, but previous experience integrating Juniper and NSX is a plus)

Can you help us with a resource with the following experience:

  • Juniper JNCIE-DC Certified

Experience with:

  • Juniper QFX 10008, QFX10002 (72Q and 60Q)
  • Juniper MX480, and MX240
  • EVPN, VXLAN, MP-BGP
  • MPLS-Based Layer 3 VPNs
  • Some Experience with VMWare NSX over Juniper underlay

items.title: Systems Administrator - REMOTE
items.content:
We have a great opportunity for a skilled Systems Administrator with our industry-leading biotechnology client in Weston. This is a remote position.

Due to client requirement, applicants must be willing and able to work on a w2 basis. For our w2 consultants, we offer a great benefits package that includes Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits, 401k with company matching, and life insurance.

Responsibilities of the Systems Administrator:
  • Maintain and support operating system integrity
  • Administer, install, and troubleshoot operating system issues
  • Perform systems maintenance tasks, including backup and recovery
  • Schedule, install, and test system software upgrades
  • Monitor and maintain licensing agreements


Requirements of the Systems Administrator:
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent
  • At least 5 years of relevant experience


Keywords: Systems Administrator, Systems Maintenance, Biotechnology, Remote

Job ID: 321572

About Eliassen Group:

Eliassen Group provides strategic talent solutions to drive our clients- innovation and business results. Leveraging over 30 years of success, our expertise in IT staffing, Agile consulting, creative services, managed services, and life sciences enables us to partner with our clients to execute their business strategy and scale effectively. Headquartered in Reading, MA and with offices from coast to coast, Eliassen Group offers local community presence, deep networks, as well as national reach. For more information, visit .

items.content:
As a government contractor, Perspecta abides by the following provision

PAY TRANSPARENCY NONDISCRIMINATION PROVISION

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

items.title: Cloud Developer (Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=8, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Description

SAIC is seeking a forward-thinking senior cloud development engineer to join our team in support of our GSA Enterprise Operations contract. Our vision at SAIC is to be the premier technology integrator in our market by making a profound difference supporting our customers missions.

The successful candidate will act as a hybrid cloud developer and play a critical role in establishing a reliable, efficient, and secure hybrid cloud solution in support of GSA s mission. The candidate will work in an Agile/DevOps environment and will have an in-depth understanding with demonstrable experience developing hybrid cloud solutions specifically within AWS and on-prem solutions like VMware and Nutanix virtual infrastructure.

Responsibilities:
Provide design guidance during discussions utilizing previous experience and industry best practices to develop hybrid cloud services.
Designs, plans, and integrates hybrid cloud services using modern cloud-native deployment techniques such as DevOps and DevSecOps.
Develops automation scripts/code for efficient deployment and operations of cloud services utilizing Terraform, Ansible, VMware vRA, and Nutanix Calm.
Maintains technical expertise, relevant industry standards, and best practices in cloud computing.
Evaluates and reports on new cloud and virtualization technologies to enhance capabilities of cloud-based and virtualized services.
May also provide systems engineering activities such as: Concept of Operations Formulation, Requirements Definition, Analysis, and Engineering.
Ensures the logical and systematic conversion of product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints.
Performs functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into infrastructure and software specifications.

Other Characteristics:
Develops creative technical solutions to complex problems.
Work is performed without appreciable direction and reviewed for desired results.
Exercises judgment in methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results.
Establishes and recommends changes to policies.
Familiar with Agile development processes.

Qualifications
Required Experience, Education, and Certifications:
5 years of IT experience, BA/BS engineering or related IT, System Engineering, or STEM degree (or an additional 2 years of experience in lieu of degree)
3 years of focused cloud development programming/scripting experience.
Experience automating service offerings utilizing Nutanix Calm.
General experience with coding/scripting using Terraform and AWS CLI/SDK.
Experience with Infrastructure as a Code (Puppet, Ansible, Chef, SaltStack, etc.).
Experience utilizing Github for management of code and services.
Experience managing AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM).
Experience integrating cloud services with scripts/code to create customer facing solutions.
Experience in Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud architecture, operations, DevOps, and administration
General administration experience of Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6/7 and Microsoft Windows Server 2012/2016.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to lead architectural and development discussions.

Other Requirements:
US Citizenship is required
Able to obtain (and maintain) GEO Public Trust designation as a condition of employment.
Able to travel up to 5 percent
Position is remote/telecommute based, 95 percent

Desired Experience and Certifications:
Experience with VMware vSphere and/or vRealize Automation.
Nutanix and/or VMware certification preferred.
Experience developing solutions with Golang.
Experience with CircleCI.
Experience using Trello and or Jira for Agile project management.
Experience utilizing Docker container services.
Experience with AWS GovCloud desired, C2S strongly preferred.
Experience developing workflow integration between cloud platforms and ServiceNow.

Clearance Level Must Currently Possess: None

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: Public Trust

Our robust portfolio of offerings includes high-end solutions in systems engineering and integration; enterprise IT, including cloud services; cyber; software; advanced analytics and simulation; and training. We are a team of 23,000 strong driven by mission, united purpose, and inspired by opportunity. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has annual revenues of approximately $6.5 billion. tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=4, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=4, apple=0, java=10, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Sr. Cloud Engineer - Can work remotely

Responsibilities:
\tWork closely within the Development and Operations organizations to support the design, automation, deployments of infrastructure and middleware
\tMaintain and transform traditional infrastructure deployment model to an infrastructure as code model with automation and monitoring.
\tDesign of cloud infrastructure with a focus on AWS using industry best practices
\tDelivery of Cloud infrastructure strategies aligned with business objectives with a focus on Cloud migrations and deployments.
\tDesign, implementation and support of infrastructure automation utilizing standardized tooling and processes.
\tResearch new cloud technologies and prototype solutions that can be leveraged to decrease costs and increase performance
\tAssess and compare cloud native PaaS with cloud-enabled traditional infrastructure
\tMentor existing staff on cloud computing best practices and technology to drive cloud adoption
\tAssist developments teams with designing new applications with a "cloud-native" approach to application architecture.

Required Experience:
\tTechnical experience in building infrastructure and applications for elasticity, resiliency,
and recoverability (Site Reliability Experience)
\tBachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, or equivalent technology discipline and/ or equivalent related development experience in lieu of degree
\t7 years of experience with Linux operating systems (RHEL, Ubuntu, CentOS)
\t2 years of experience with cloud infrastructure technologies (AWS strongly preferred)
\tStrong understanding across cloud and infrastructure components (server, storage, data, and applications) to deliver end to end cloud infrastructure architectures and designs
\t2 years of experience automating infrastructure in a cloud environment, including the use of Git to automate workflow of code from development to production.
Tooling We Use:
\tBash, Python, or Ruby scripting
\tElasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana (ELK) Stack
\tPuppet Enterprise (Chef, Ansible, or Salt experience OK)
\tTerraform (Experience with Terraform -strongly- preferred)
\tCI/CD Pipeline: Jenkins, Bitbucket (Any git provider OK), Artifactory
\tRundeck
\tAnything that improves our ability to automate tasks
Required/Desired Skills Skill Required /Desired Amount of Experience Bash, Python, or Ruby scripting Required 0 Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana (ELK) Stack Required 0 Terraform (Experience with Terraform -strongly- preferred) Required 0 CI/CD Pipeline: Jenkins, Bitbucket (Any git provider OK), Artifactory Required 0

Thanks

Udhayakumar Selvam

Senior US IT Recruiter

Technosoft Corporation

One Towne Square, Suite 600

Southfield, MI 48076

Direct : +1

items.content:
Description

SAIC is seeking a forward-thinking senior cloud development engineer to join our team in support of our GSA Enterprise Operations contract. Our vision at SAIC is to be the premier technology integrator in our market by making a profound difference supporting our customers missions.

The successful candidate will act as a hybrid cloud developer and play a critical role in establishing a reliable, efficient, and secure hybrid cloud solution in support of GSA s mission. The candidate will work in an Agile/DevOps environment and will have an in-depth understanding with demonstrable experience developing hybrid cloud solutions specifically within AWS and on-prem solutions like VMware and Nutanix virtual infrastructure.

Responsibilities:
Provide design guidance during discussions utilizing previous experience and industry best practices to develop hybrid cloud services.
Designs, plans, and integrates hybrid cloud services using modern cloud-native deployment techniques such as DevOps and DevSecOps.
Develops automation scripts/code for efficient deployment and operations of cloud services utilizing Terraform, Ansible, VMware vRA, and Nutanix Calm.
Maintains technical expertise, relevant industry standards, and best practices in cloud computing.
Evaluates and reports on new cloud and virtualization technologies to enhance capabilities of cloud-based and virtualized services.
May also provide systems engineering activities such as: Concept of Operations Formulation, Requirements Definition, Analysis, and Engineering.
Ensures the logical and systematic conversion of product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints.
Performs functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into infrastructure and software specifications.

Other Characteristics:
Develops creative technical solutions to complex problems.
Work is performed without appreciable direction and reviewed for desired results.
Exercises judgment in methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results.
Establishes and recommends changes to policies.
Familiar with Agile development processes.

Qualifications
Required Experience, Education, and Certifications:
5 years of IT experience, BA/BS engineering or related IT, System Engineering, or STEM degree (or an additional 2 years of experience in lieu of degree)
3 years of focused cloud development programming/scripting experience.
Experience automating service offerings utilizing Nutanix Calm.
General experience with coding/scripting using Terraform and AWS CLI/SDK.
Experience with Infrastructure as a Code (Puppet, Ansible, Chef, SaltStack, etc.).
Experience utilizing Github for management of code and services.
Experience managing AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM).
Experience integrating cloud services with scripts/code to create customer facing solutions.
Experience in Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud architecture, operations, DevOps, and administration
General administration experience of Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6/7 and Microsoft Windows Server 2012/2016.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to lead architectural and development discussions.

Other Requirements:
US Citizenship is required
Able to obtain (and maintain) GEO Public Trust designation as a condition of employment.
Able to travel up to 5 percent
Position is remote/telecommute based, 95 percent

Desired Experience and Certifications:
Experience with VMware vSphere and/or vRealize Automation.
Nutanix and/or VMware certification preferred.
Experience developing solutions with Golang.
Experience with CircleCI.
Experience using Trello and or Jira for Agile project management.
Experience utilizing Docker container services.
Experience with AWS GovCloud desired, C2S strongly preferred.
Experience developing workflow integration between cloud platforms and ServiceNow.

Job Posting Date: 2019-07-:36:16 UTC

Primary Location: FLEXWORK, VA 22102 US

Clearance Level Must Currently Possess: None

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: Public Trust

Potential for Teleworking: Yes

Travel: None

Shift: Day Job

Schedule:

SAIC is a premier technology integrator, solving our nation's most complex modernization and systems engineering challenges across the defense, space, federal civilian, and intelligence markets. Our robust portfolio of offerings includes high-end solutions in systems engineering and integration; enterprise IT, including cloud services; cyber; software; advanced analytics and simulation; and training. We are a team of 23,000 strong driven by mission, united purpose, and inspired by opportunity. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has annual revenues of approximately $6.5 billion. For more information, visit saic.com. For information on the benefits SAIC offers, see Working at SAIC . EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability
- provided by Dice

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote Operation Specialist Landing.Work

Company: Landing.jobs
Location: Lisbon, PT
Remote location: Fully remote
Level: Intermediate
Language: Portuguese
Product/Project Management
Skills:
  • Customer Support
  • Recruitment

    • Intro

    Landing’s mission is to reshape the future of work by transforming the way career development and hiring work. As a step on the journey, we’ve just launched the alpha version of a new product that we’re calling Landing.work.

    We’ve launched Landing.work to help solve some of the challenges tech professionals face when working remotely as contractors, which are two growing trends. Landing.work will help tech professionals benefit from all the advantages of working as a Contractor such as getting higher pay, choosing their own clients and setting their own rates.

    Our plan for the first months is to roll-out Landing.work for contractors based in Portugal and learn a lot from the process. Being part of this team means you are going to help and evaluate contractors during the evaluation process. You will also support our Operations team to guarantee that we are providing the best service possible.

    What you will be doing

    • Support and evaluate the contractors going through the evaluation funnel;
    • Understand what are our contractors’ likes and dislikes about the process;
    • Help improving things like CV and Landing.work’s profile;
    • Give support during the matching process, including rate counselling, career development opportunities and others;
    • Match client projects with the best contractors available;
    • Share useful information about companies and job openings;


     This is a remote position which means that you can work from wherever you want (as long as you manage 5+ hours of common working time with the remaining team). However, with freedom comes responsibility - this means your work will be measured by the results you present.

    Main requirements

    • 2+ years of experience working in fast-paced environments;
    • (Plus) Experience in account manager and recruitment;
    • Accountability and ownership of your own responsibilities;
    • You must be a people’s person and someone really communicative;
    • Data-driven mindset and solution-oriented;
    • Positive and proactive attitude, always aiming for more;
    • Fluent in Portuguese and English;
    • Multi-tasking ability.


    Nice to have

    • Passionate about the HR/Recruiting Tech industry.

    Perks

    • You can work from wherever you want (as long as you manage 5+ hours of common working time with the remaining team);
    • (Optional) 2-3 days per month at the Landing office;
    • Training and resources available so you continuously improve yourself;
    • A commission model that is designed to ignite you.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Cyber Systems Engineer

United States, Nebraska
Company: Peraton

Overview

Overview
Peraton is seeking a senior cyber security engineer in Omaha, Nebraska with thorough understanding of the DoD Risk Management Framework (RMF) per DoDI 8510.01 and the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800 series set of documents.

Responsibilities
What you’ll do…

  • Lead a team evaluating “end-to-end” systems and subsystems from a cyber security perspective. Conduct research and evaluate technical performance and cyber vulnerabilities.
  • Ensure components and systems comply with requirements and government information assurance and cyber security standards and practices through formal verification methods.
  • Verify and validate components and systems with specific emphasis on network operations and cyber security tactics, techniques, and procedures focused on the threats to information networks.
  • Assess component and system performance using evaluation criteria and technical performance measures. Prepare assessments and cyber threat profiles based on testing, research, and analysis.
  • Participate in design reviews of components and systems (hardware and software) to ensure applicability to the system and traceability of cyber requirements.
  • Review test plans/procedures and ensure they verify/validate cyber requirements. Develop and maintain analytical procedures to meet changing requirements.
  • Produce high-quality papers, presentations, recommendations, and findings for senior US government and operations officials.
  • DOD security Hardening
  • Collection and assessment tools (STIGs, VMS/SCAP, Nessus, etc.)
  • Security Architectures
  • Boundary and network devices (firewalls, routers, switches, etc.)
  • Identify, assess, and validate baseline security controls (BCS)
  • Prepare Plan of Action & Milestone (PoA&Ms) to document and mitigate cybersecurity deficiencies.
Qualifications
You’d be a great fit if…

  • You have a Bachelor of Science undergraduate degree
  • You possess a DoD 8570 Certification Information Assurance Technical (IAT) Level II minimum
  • You are proficient with MS Office suite

It would be even better if you…

  • Have a Master’s degree in engineering, cyber, or STEM area
  • Have knowledge of SEI CMMI DEV 1.3 Level 3 processes
  • Possess knowledge of Atlassian tool suite
  • Have knowledge and use of eMASS
  • Crrently have an active DoD Secret Security Clearance

What you’ll get…

  • An immediately-vested 401(K) with employer matching
  • Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Tuition assistance, financing, and refinancing
  • Company-paid infertility treatments
  • Cross-training and professional development opportunities
  • Influence major initiatives
About Peraton
Are you ready to join the next-generation of national security? Peraton is a fresh name in the industry with an established portfolio and legacy going back more than a century. We work differently than our peers – with agility, the freedom to innovate, an entrepreneurial spirit and a culture of responsibility. As part of the Peraton team, you’ll be part of our movement to build a great company, solve the most daunting challenges facing mankind today, to protect and promote freedom around the world, and to secure our future, for our families, our communities, our nation, and our way of life.

EEO Statement
We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We consider applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or membership in any other group protected by federal, state, or local law.

Apply for job

items.title: Senior Weapon Systems Engineer – Laurel
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=24, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=24}
items.content:
Senior Weapon Systems Engineer – Laurel

United States, Maryland
Company: Johns Hopkins Applied Physics Laboratory (APL)

Overview

Are you a “systems thinker” with advanced systems engineering experience that wants to have impact on nationally important defense programs?

Do you love working with a diverse group of dedicated technical specialists in a collaborative teaming environment?

If so, we’re looking for someone like you to join our team at APL.

We are seeking a Senior Systems Engineer for the Weapon Systems Engineering Group in the Force Projection Sector. We provide vital systems engineering and system development expertise to nationally important strategic deterrence capabilities for the Navy and Air Force. As a member of our team, you will develop and assess requirements, develop architectures, build and modify analysis tools, develop test plans and analyze test data, perform trade studies, requirements analysis, functional analysis, and performance assessment for strategic weapons systems development programs. We are passionate about making critical contributions to these critically important programs, and you will be a key part of our success. With your help, we will remain at the forefront of weapon systems engineering for the Force Projection Sector.

As a Senior Weapon Systems Engineer…

  • Your primary responsibility will be to provide systems engineering thought leadership and expertise focusing on requirements analysis, concept/technology development, risk assessments and test & evaluation for strategic deterrent systems.
  • You will utilize tools to analyze weapon system capabilities and to assist in the development of future weapon system requirements.
  • You will participate in design and requirements reviews.
  • You will provide domain expertise while leading/coordinating research, studies, and analysis on current and future weapons system capabilities and performance, as well as provide supporting data and associated recommendations to advise program sponsors.
  • You will deliver formal presentations to sponsors and supporting contractors, and effectively communicate proposed concepts/solutions and analysis results. You will produce reports that bring together concept definitions, requirements, analysis results, and technical recommendations.

You meet our minimum qualifications for the job if you…

  • Have a Bachelor’s degree in engineering, mathematics, physics or related technical field.
  • Have 7 years of experience performing systems engineering in the design, development or evaluation of complex weapon systems.
  • Are highly skilled in early concept development, requirements analysis, design, test and evaluation, and risk assessment.
  • Have especially strong verbal and written communication skills, as well as strong critical thinking skills.
  • Have shown the ability to interact effectively with and lead diverse, multidisciplinary teams, including industry and government sponsors.
  • Are willing and able to travel periodically, including short duration visits to sponsor offices at the Washington Navy Yard and to supporting contractor sites, as well as occasional travel to other military bases across the country.
  • Hold an active Secret security clearance and are able to get a Top Secret clearance. If selected, you will be subject to a government security clearance investigation and must meet the requirements for access to classified information. Eligibility requirements include U.S. citizenship.

You’ll go above and beyond our minimum requirements if you…

  • Have an advanced degree in systems engineering.
  • Have experience in systems engineering for missile systems.
  • Have experience with DoD acquisition processes, Navy Strategic Systems programs, and/or Air Force ICBM programs.
  • Have familiarity with systems engineering software, especially model based systems engineering tools like Magic Draw and DOORS.
  • Have experience with new DoD program development to include concept development and Pre-Milestone A activities.
  • Have knowledge of the Navy Trident II Strategic Weapon System and/or Air Force ICBM System.
  • Hold an active Top Secret security clearance.

Why work at APL?


The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) brings world-class expertise to our nation’s most critical defense, security, space and science challenges. With a wide selection of challenging, impactful work and a robust education assistance program, APL promotes a culture of life-long learning. Our employees enjoy generous benefits and healthy work/life balance. APL’s campus is located in the Baltimore-Washington metro area. Learn more about our career opportunities at .

APL is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Apply for job

items.title: Senior DevOps Engineer (Full or Part-time)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=8, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content: > Here's to the crazy ones. The hackers. The doers. The curious geeks in a world of corporate zombies...A cool, fully-remote startup is looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer… preferably one that does NOT s*ck! You must be speaking CloudFormation through your sleep and know AWS like the back of your hand.On top of the salary, you'll get generous stock options, performance-based bonuses, and annual profit share, as well as extensive training and mentoring, **BUT…**You must be a **perfectionist** — you're simply too passionate about your work to call something "done" when it's not near perfect yet!Do you remember how "*Monica*" from *F.R.I.E.N.D.S* was obsessed with the little details? Now, imagine if she became a DevOps engineer somehow… Do you think this is you?# **Okay, we want to hire you if you're an expert with:**- CloudFormation; Experience with running multiple dedicated formations, and stack updates with continuous deployment- EC2; Secure VPC setup, EC2 Networking, & ELB- CloudWatch; Experience with consolidating log streams, and event triggers at scale- Managing RDS at scale with redundancy and backups- Production-grade security with IAM- Lambda and Serverless technologies- CloudTrail and X-Ray; experience with debugging cloud systems- CloudFront for React SPA- Amazon API Gateway- S3; including object notifications and integration with CloudWatch- Setting up SQS for large scale processing- Extra points for: *[NOT Required]* - Terraform, EKS, Neptune, Elastic Beanstalk, Step Function, DynamoDB, Athena, Batch, Kinesis, Amazon EventBridge, AWS CDK - Python, Golang, or Javascript # **So, what will we build together?**DealTracker is a real-time, AI-powered deal aggregator that collects deals from all the major online retailers in the US and ranks them based on factors like current and historical prices across different stores, product reviews, brand reputation, etc.It's also a social platform for curated shopping, where people can create shareable product collections in a Pinterest-like fashion. They can also follow their favorite brands and product categories for personalized deal discovery.We didn't launch the product yet, but [you can demo our old proof of concept here to get an idea](https://airtable.com/shrWko0aHUqtw2Z2I). [Not Public - Please, don't share it] # **Are you the real deal? Let's talk!**If any of the above stuff didn't scare you yet, now is the time to apply and join our team of A-player *Monicas.*## **[Fill this quick form to apply](https://airtable.com/shrXOjPEQMn1lPXxo)**It only takes a few minutes, and a resume is not required.Our process is fast, and you'll know our final decision within a week. We are also very flexible on timezones, and you get to choose the hours of the day you want to work. This job should fit nicely with your typical workday if you're from Europe, North America, or MEA.

items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Linux, XenDesktop, Xen, Citrix, VMWare, Cloudstack, Chef, Ansible, Puppet, EC2

Job Title: Systems Engineer
Job Location: Remote - must be located in Southern California
Compensation: $90K to $100K with sensational benefits
Skills: Linux, Configuration Management, AWS, Scripting/Development, Enterprise deployments

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- Incredible PTO package and benefits 100% paid by Company
- We provide you with the best tools, equipment, and support to help you succeed in this remote position
- We are an industry leader with a global and rapidly expanding footprint

What You Will Be Doing

- Supporting, maintaining and improving our Linux environments
- Helping to diagnose and resolve issues within our production and development environments
- Automating configuration management
- Keeping up to date and learning new technologies to improve yourself and the capabilities of the team
- Creating and migrating development and production systems, in code, using chef and ansible

What You Need for this Position

Linux knowledge
You would class yourself as an expert in this field and can demonstrate your extensive capabilities in this area

Automation skills
With good working knowledge of at least one of the common automation tools preferably Chef, Ansible or Puppet, you should also find Shell scripting a breeze

Networking/Load Balancing
TCPIP, DNS, DHCP, HA and Capacity Management

Working in a Compliance based Environment
Familiar and able to work under change control processes within a compliant work environment

Encryption & Security
Our customer's data is precious, knowledge about this is useful such as Linux Disk Encryption, Linux Hardening

Virtualization
Our service runs on Xen infrastructure and it would be good if you had knowledge in this area. Knowledge of VMWare and Cloudstack would also be good

Storage
We have Netapp storage as well as QNAP devices, support in this area would prove beneficial

Working with Linux in Amazon EC2
We deploy on Amazon EC2 and are looking at this strategically, knowledge in this area would prove advantageous

What's In It for You

- Vacation/PTO
- Medical
- Dental
- Vision
- Bonus
- 401k with up to 10% matchSo, if you are a Systems Engineer with the required experience and seeking career advancement, please apply today!

If you are a Lead SRE Engineer with 5+ years experience in a DevOps/SRE/SysAdmin role, please read on!

We have the least attrition of any company in the greater Los Angeles area and we offer an unparalleled culture on top of competitive pay, benefits and cutting edge technology. This role has the opportunity to be FULLY REMOTE.

This role will report to the Director of Platform Engineering, and will lead a growing team of high-performing engineers.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

1. We are digital data collection company that is setting a higher standard for data quality.
2. Our company is rapidly-growing and we just moved into a beautiful new office.
3. You will have the chance to work on exciting new development projects with a talented team.

What You Will Be Doing

-Report to the Director of Platform Engineering, lead a growing team of high-performing engineers
-Help define and enforce DevOps standards, procedures, and guidelines to improve the overall development process
-Provide technical leadership and guidance to both your team members and your peers
-Cultivate a modern DevOps culture and mindset throughout your teams and establish performance metrics and processes to improve velocity and deliverability
-Deploy and support high-performance, highly-available infrastructure on AWS
-Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning
-Conduct periodic on-call duties
-Own the day-to-day health, uptime, monitoring, and reliability of our cloud infrastructure
-Work closely with engineering and project management to develop tools and solutions
-Identify tactical issues and react to emerging areas of concern
-Identify unnecessary complexity and remove it

What You Need for this Position

-5+ years experience in an SRE/SysAdmin, DevOps, or equivalent role
-3+ years of production AWS experience, including but not limited to EC2, RDS, ElastiCache, S3, Auto Scale, ELB
-2+ years of experience in technical leadership role managing DevOps in Agile environments (Scrum)
-Capability to program in at least one language (other than Bash), ideally Python, PHP or Java

-Experience with CI/CD tools and production code deployments

items.content:
If interested, please call: Iram Shah at ext: 222 OR Email me at


Sponsorship is not available for this role.
Azure Cloud Infrastructure Lead (end to end Azure experience)


Full-time


Location: REMOTE with some onsite in malvern, PA


Description:



  • They need an end to end Azure Lead expert who can :-
  • Design, implement, architect, automate and troubleshoot platforms
  • They need experience with infrastructure in Azure environment- Networking, Security, Storage, Backups, Encryption walls, managing various regions in Azure
  • They need someone who can automate deployments in Azure cloud
  • Should be able to operationally support everything under Azure, documentation of standard operating procedures (SOPs)
  • Work with offshore teams and offshore consulting partners as and when required

EDUCATION

Minimum Required Skills:
Devops, AWS, SRE, SysAdmin, Docker, RDS, ElastiCache, Linux, Bash, Agile

If you are a Lead DevOps Engineer with 5+ years experience in a SysAdmin, DevOps, SRE or equivalent role? If so, please read on!

We have the least attrition of any company in the greater Los Angeles area and we offer an unparalleled culture on top of competitive pay, benefits and cutting edge technology. This role has the opportunity to be FULLY REMOTE.

This role will report to the Director of Platform Engineering, and will lead a growing team of high-performing engineers.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

1. We are digital data collection company that is setting a higher standard for data quality.
2. Our company is rapidly-growing and we just moved into a beautiful new office.
3. You will have the chance to work on exciting new development projects with a talented team.

What You Will Be Doing

-Report to the Director of Platform Engineering, lead a growing team of high-performing engineers
-Help define and enforce DevOps standards, procedures, and guidelines to improve the overall development process
-Provide technical leadership and guidance to both your team members and your peers
-Cultivate a modern DevOps culture and mindset throughout your teams and establish performance metrics and processes to improve velocity and deliverability
-Deploy and support high-performance, highly-available infrastructure on AWS
-Engage in service capacity planning and demand forecasting, software performance analysis and system tuning
-Conduct periodic on-call duties
-Own the day-to-day health, uptime, monitoring, and reliability of our cloud infrastructure
-Work closely with engineering and project management to develop tools and solutions
-Identify tactical issues and react to emerging areas of concern
-Identify unnecessary complexity and remove it

What You Need for this Position

-5+ years experience in an SRE/SysAdmin, DevOps, or equivalent role
-3+ years of production AWS experience, including but not limited to EC2, RDS, ElastiCache, S3, Auto Scale, ELB
-2+ years of experience in technical leadership role managing DevOps in Agile environments (Scrum)
-Capability to program in at least one language (other than Bash), ideally Python, PHP or Java
-Solid knowledge of the Linux architecture
-Experience with container stacks and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, Mesos, ECS, etc)
-Experience with Configuration Management tools such as Puppet, Chef, Salt, or Ansible
-Experience with Infrastructure as a Code frameworks such as Terraform
-Experience with Microservices
-Experience with application monitoring tools (DataDog, New Relic, SumoLogic, etc)
-Strong knowledge of core protocols and tech such as TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, load balancers, distributed file systems, key-value and relational databases
-Excellent organizational skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced work environment
-Experience with CI/CD tools and production code deployments

What's In It for You

- Competitive Salary
- Health, Dental & Vision Insurance
- Flexible hours
- MacBook Pros
- Overall engaging and fun atmosphereSo, if you are a Lead DevOps Engineer, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

items.content:
Senior DevOps Engineer at DECA Games

Remote | International
  • Berlin, DE
  • Remote OK
  • Full-Time

We are looking for a Senior Dev Ops Engineer to work on a beloved game that has existed for a few years but needs a passionate team to help take it over and give it some new life.

DECA acquires older games that have loyal audiences that we believe that can last another decade. We brings our unique player focused approach to operations to help bring back disenfranchised players and retain the players that love the game very much.

DECA has a created a flexible work environment with people able to work from multiple locations and flex their hours to meet their personal obligations. We believe in flat organizations, small trusted and empowered teams, and long term thinking.

DevOps Engineer

The project is a late stage game using Amazon infrastructure technologies. The main goal of the project is to find smart ways to optimize cost at the same time maintaining stability of the infrastructure.

Experience and skills:

  • Experience optimizing cost on a high volume infrastructure
  • Autoscaling and provisioning of new hosts and AWS resources such as Elasticache memcache and RDS MySQL shards.
  • Expertise is required in AWS including CloudFormation, IAM, S3, Elasticache, RDS, DynamoDB, ELB and EC2 AutoScaling. Expertise in Git, Puppet, Docker and Jenkins is required.
  • Configurations stored in Git
  • Big plus for experience server-side application troubleshooting in PHP / HHVM

Responsibilities

  • Analyze infrastructure costs and risks to identify cost savings and improve stability
  • Implement infrastructure optimizations
  • Level 2 analysis and troubleshooting of servers and AWS services using Datadog, Pingdom and Cloudwatch
  • Troubleshooting using SumoLogic to analyze logs
  • Updating Puppet manifests in Git to adjust software configurations
  • Updating Cloudformation in Git to adjust AWS configurations
  • Updating Dockerfiles in Git to adjust production containers and build containers in Jenkins
Apply for job

Job Description

Cloud Architect with DevOps experience

Must live within a 60 minute drive from any of the following locations: Dallas, Jacksonville, Philadelphia, Atlanta, Chicago, Houston, San Antonio, Richmond, Birmingham, Baltimore, DC, Boston, Charlotte, East Rutherford, NYC

Rate: $75.00 per hour

Tax: W2 (only)

Project Length: 6+ Months possible extension

Remote: With some travel involved

Travel: 3% - 10%

Work Status: US Citizen or Permanent Resident(GC) for this Govt. contract

Manager Notes:

1) Candidate must demonstrate the ability to operate outside the defined boundaries.

2) Candidates design and build this framework not leverage and existing one

3) We are looking for candidates who can effectively operate in a software development framework and help set it up

4) The candidate must be strong with regard to security

Qualifications:

1) Oversees and directs major, critical and emerging technology studies. Assesses merit and impact; designs, develops and establishes architecture standards.

2) Oversees and directs architectural discussions for both a technical and management audience.

3) Partners with our clients and other resources in detecting critical architectural and infrastructure gaps or deficiencies in the IT environment.

4) Recommend and implements solutions for improvement.

5) Recommends and implements changes to business information and technical architecture requirements.

6) Initiates and oversees project development, system design/testing, requirement direction and investigation of alternatives for implementation of feasible new technology.

7) Provides key consultative leadership on System projects focused on planning, development and implementation of strategic technological directives.

8) Provides strategic foresight and long-term development planning for future technology impacting the system.

9) Performs other related duties as assigned. Working Conditions: Will require the use of standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, etc.

Physical Demands:

1) Requires some degree of sitting (for prolonged periods of time), standing, lifting carrying, pushing, pulling more than 20 lbs.

Hours of Work:

1) May require extended work hours. Occasional travel including overnight stays may be necessary.

2) May be subject to on-call and call back as needed. May be exposed to moderate noise from equipment.

Experience / Skill:

1) Possessing architecture, developer or DevOps cloud certifications or equivalent experience from AWS or Azure.

2) 5+ years of experience with IT solution delivery, working on design, implementation, and operations for distributed applications.

3) 2+ years of experience with public, private, and hybrid Cloud services and the planning, development, migration, and integration of applications and services from on-premises infrastructure to Cloud-based Container-as-a-Service, Platform-as-a-Service and Infrastructure-as-a-Service services.

4) Experience developing solutions using infrastructure as code and configuration management tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, AWS Cloud Formation Templates, Azure Resource Manager, Microsoft Desired State Control, etc

5) Experience working with tools and services in the areas of Cloud orchestration, configuration management, monitoring, log aggregation and other associated service areas.

6) Understanding of NIST standards and requirements, security governance frameworks and the Federal Risk Authorization Management Program

7) Designs varying levels of complex frameworks to support system-wide technical and business architecture requirements.

8) Defines processes for technical platforms, system specifications, and technical and business compatibility. Identifies, analyzes and resolves design weaknesses.

9) Works with management in carrying out strategic initiatives focused on designing, planning, developing and synchronizing strategic technological directives and implementation recommendations.

10) Advanced level position is recognized as an advanced contributor and subject matter expert in field. Knowledge: Advanced knowledge pertaining to concepts and principles in functional area.

11) General knowledge of department/business lines, and / or System operations, policies, procedures and technologies.

Communications:

1) Excellent organizational and communication skills, creativity, attention to detail (compliance) and negotiation skills to interpret results, develop communications and recommend improvements.

2) Able to present information within all settings in a credible, confident and influential manner. Communicates in a concise, direct and purposeful way.

3) Excellent customer service skills and demonstrated ability to interact with anticipated audiences in a courteous, service-oriented manner.

Risk Management:

1) [The individual] is responsible for understanding and applying risk management discipline in decision making and contributing to his or her function`s risk management.

Decision Making:

1) Works independently on broad assignments or under general directions as to scope or objectives. Makes decisions within established or widely accepted standards. Achieves assigned/planned results by decisions and actions based on professional methods, training, business principles, and practical experience.

2) Knowledgeable across a broad range of IT subject areas including infrastructure, application development, security and networking.

3) Demonstrated experienced at developing and implementing cloud solutions in AWS or Azure.

4) Demonstrated experience leading the design, development and deployment of applications and middleware or current hands experience with technology infrastructure areas such as network, compute, storage, and virtualization.

5) Experienced with software development life cycle using agile development methodologies.

6) Experience with IT compliance and risk management requirements (eg. security, privacy, RAMP, SOX, HIPAA etc.)

7) Excellent organizational and communication skills, creativity, attention to detail and negotiation skills to interpret results, develop communications and recommend improvements.

8) Excellent customer service skills and demonstrated ability to interact with anticipated audiences in a courteous, service-oriented manner.

9) Works independently on broad assignments or under general directions as to scope or objectives.

Notes:

1) Must be a US Citizen or Permanent Resident (GC)

2) No Sponsorship available

3) No 3rdParty Candidates

4) No 3rdParty Vendors

5) Enhanced Background Check

items.content:
Principal Systems Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Computer Software, Cybersecurity, Information Technology
Company size: 1k–5k people
Company type: Public
Company: Carbon Black | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time +/- 2 hours

Technologies

azure
asp.net-web-api
cloud

Job description

** This position can be based in our Waltham, MA office or remote in Massachusetts**

  • Provide support for all relevant projects including installation and maintenance, troubleshooting, system monitoring and alerting and timely problem resolution.
  • Adhere to established SLAs in responding to and completing service tickets, including providing a high level of customer support, detailed root cause analysis, and trouble reports for system outages. Adhere to established departmental operational policies and procedures.
  • Act as a contact person for outside vendors during installation, production changes, and repair and/or removal of equipment or services.
  • Utilize software and hardware diagnostic tools to identify, diagnose and repair complex problems and issues affecting system performance.
  • Assist in the development of network and BCP documentation, including diagrams, equipment inventories and Departmental Procedures.
  • Proactively monitor system performance to discover problems before they affect the customer. Ensures system life-cycle are healthy, and that systems are at current/stable/supported software versions. Research and evaluate new platform features and functionalities that can benefit the firm.
  • Accessible to perform after hours support duties on a rotating 24x7 basis to sustain networking systems and end user support.
  • Maintain Windows Active Directory infrastructure and standalone server environment
  • Maintain Office 365 services such as Exchange, SharePoint, OneDrive, and Azure AD
  • Design and implement improvements to business workflow, data security and access, and collaboration through further Office 365 integration and third-party tools
  • Develop High Level Designs and Architectures– Create and document Microsoft Cloud (ie Azure, O365, PowerBI/SQL Server, etc..) solution architectures that address business problems and needs
Requirements (“What You’ll Bring”)
  • 5 or more years of experience working with Microsoft technologies.
  • Broad experience across the Microsoft on-prem stack with deeper experience in at least 3-4 of the following:
    • Microsoft Exchange 2010 or newer (2013, 2016, 2019)
    • Windows Server 2008 R2 and newer
    • Active Directory Domain Services with integrated DNS
    • Active Directory Certification Services (PKI)
    • System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) 2012 R2 or newer
    • Office 365 - Exchange Online, OneDrive, Sharepoint and Azure AD sync
    • Microsoft Enterprise Mobility Suite (Intune mobile device management)
  • Experience with Microsoft Office 365 and moving workloads to Office 365:
    • Exchange Online
    • Sharepoint Online
    • Azure Active Directory
  • Research and develop high level designs and architectures– Create and document Microsoft on-prem or preferrably cloud (ie Azure, O365, PowerBI/SQL Server, etc..) solution architectures that address business problems and needs, including backups and disaster recovery
  • Act as a contact and liaison for vendors either to support technical projects or to open tickets for incident escalation.
  • Collaborate with the team, be willing to learn about other roles and provide backup assistance and coverage on an occasional basis, plus an on-call rotation for after-hours support of critical infrastructure
  • Attention to detail and ability to logically troubleshoot and solve problems that often have not been seen before
  • Communicate and build relationships with other staff and teams to productively achieve outcomes and complete projects
  • Observe existing project and team process and policy but make recommendations for improvements
  • Work toward reducing redundant tasks, procedures, efforts by recommending process improvements, tools, software, and/or writing scripts.
  • Document technical architecture specs, diagrams, knowledge base articles, and how-tos.
Preferred:
  • Microsoft PowerShell scripting (moderate to advanced); including error logging, connecting to/querying databases, secure credentials, write your own modules.
  • Practical knowledge of SSO and MFA technologies such as ADFS, Okta, Duo.
  • Project management, leadership, mentoring, and training skills.
  • Knowledge of Agile tools and practices and previous work in a Scrum team.
  • Industry specific certifications especially in Microsoft technologies or Cybersecurity or Information Security.
  • Cloud computing experience in Azure or AWS, particularly lifecycle and/or migration of on-prem workloads to the cloud, leveraging cloud-specific technologies and advantages (as opposed to purely a lift and shift)
Apply now

About Carbon Black

Why you should join us:

Carbon Black is a leading provider of next-generation endpoint security, leveraging breakthrough prevention technology to instantly see and stop cyberattacks before they execute. With more than 14 million endpoints under management, and more than 4,600 customers—including one-third of the Fortune 100—the opportunities are massive and exciting. With 1,200+ employees, offices across the world, and the best-of-the-best tools for collaboration from anywhere, now is an ideal time to become part of the Cb Team. See where you fit best atLifeatcb.carbonblack.com.

Carbon Black, Inc. is an EEO/AA employer. Carbon Black is an inclusive employer that believes in workplace equality, supports diversity, creates a welcoming environment, and respects the unique qualities each individual brings to the company.

Benefits

  • Flexible vacation
  • Remote/Work-from-home options
  • Medical/Dental/Vision
  • Stand-up desks and unique workspaces
  • Free snacks/drinks, Happy Hours, and regular catering
  • Care.com access and pet insurance
  • On-site gym
  • Career development programs
  • Lounge/game room
  • Competitive salaries, 401k, and stock options

items.content:
DevOps Engineer (Cloud) (m/f/d) // Caspar Health

Company: Caspar Health

Tags:
  • DevOps
  • Developer

    • Contribute to our Infrastructure at Caspar.

    Caspar-Health was founded in 2016 to revolutionize the world of therapies. Currently, the access to medical therapies (i.e. prevention or rehabilitation) is restricted and patients often do not get the best possible treatment for their recovery. By using the Caspar-Health App, we allow to overcome the limits of temporal and local therapy access and give everyone the opportunity to train at any time and anywhere. On Caspar therapists create and share therapy plans with their patients and both parties interact via various features. Caspar-Health is working with the most valued medical facilities in Germany and Asia and is the leader for B2B app-based tele-therapy platforms.

    Role Description

    We are looking for a very motivated DevOps Engineer (not remote). Someone excited to tackle interesting challenges, willing to take responsibility, and loves working in a powerful team in our office in Berlin-Mitte.

    You will be leading our infrastructure and be part of our development team to improve product quality, deployment processes and infrastructure quality (cloud – AWS).

    As part of our Engineering team you will:

    • Maintain and improve existing CI infrastructure. Extend and enhance our development workflows;
    • Support infrastructure requirements for development teams;
    • Be in touch with development and QA teams in order to deliver high-performance solutions;
    • Maintain the best practices in terms of security and high availability;

    What is expected from you:

    • Can demonstrate experience in computer networking and Linux administration;
    • You understand principles of load balancing and high availability;
    • You understand security and data privacy best practices;
    • You have worked with AWS cloud and specifically with ECS, RDS, S3, AWS Lambda.
    • “Configuration as code” sounds familiar to you and you had previous experience with Terraform;
    • You worked with Docker in production environment;
    • Have good written and verbal communication skills in English.

    Bonus points:

    • Previous work experience for web and mobile products, within the eHealth and/or digital healthcare sector;
    • Written and/or verbal communication skills in German;
    • Experience with more than one cloud provider;
    • Experience with Continuous Integration tools – Jenkins;
    • Amazon Associate certificate would be a plus;
    • Ruby or JavaScript/TypeScript programming skills;
    • Worked in Agile environment.

    What we offer:

    • Responsibility: Be the person to help extending our infrastructure. Define and maintain deployment processes, and support setting up high available production and test environments;
    • Professional Development: An opportunity to bring innovation in the health-care sector;
    • Team: We have an excellent and multicultural team spread across several departments, all with high ambitions;
    • Well-being: We take care of our team. Besides fresh fruits and drinks that are available in the office, we have one monthly breakfast and weekly lunches together.
    • Balance: We empower the balance of Work and Life. We offer two days per week the opportunity to work from home. Whenever you need them, take them!
    • Equipment: Our aim is to make everything possible to make you feel comfortable and happy. Let us know what it needs! Also we have an extra Budget for conferences or courses
    • Location: Cozy office space located in the center of Berlin, Mitte;

    You should include these in your application:

    • A short introduction describing your background and what motivates you. What projects have you enjoyed working on? Which have you disliked?
    • A description of your work history (whether as a resume, LinkedIn profile, or prose).
    Apply for this position
