tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
DevOps Engineer, Cloud - Remote 100%.
Contract and Perm.

The role:
The right candidate will be joining the well-established and successful DevOps as a systems engineer working closely with the Software development team. You will spearhead operations management of developed solutions including log management, monitoring/alerting, infrastructure provisioning, system patching, configuration management, and support. As part of the product development team, you will actively participate in agile development practices working closely with engineers to maintain and enhance infrastructure management and CI/CD processes to optimize for quality, reliability, and availability. You will ensure that security, performance, and disaster preparedness are always represented in team decisions. You will gain and expand on your experience managing cloud native micro services utilizing Docker and clustering technologies such as ECS and Kubenetes.
Responsibilities:
-Match infrastructure implementation / monitoring / management with software architecture
-Influence software architecture to simplify / streamline operational management
-Working close with the developers
-Manage All Environments
-Monitor running instances - ensure costs are managed and optimized against performance
-Configuration changes / documentation / automation of changes
-Monitor / manage logs
-Patch management
-Security and key management
-Establish and monitor operational dashboards and work queues
-Monitor infrastructure / application performance & health
-Shared software release duties
-Developing and monitoring infrastructure automation for deployment
-Code coverage metrics
-Monitor build / deployment status
Required experience:
-Be passionate about being challenged and hungry to continuously learn
-Mid-level to Senior on typical operations front (operating system patching, systematic troubleshooting, eye for operational details)
-Must have experience and be extremely comfortable with Unix/Linux server environments
-Comfortable with command line tools Bash, Powershell etc.
-Working understanding of code and script development e.g. Python.
-Familiar with agile software development lifecycles
-Knowledge of best practices and IT operations for always-up, always-available services
-Docker / container cluster management (AWS ECS, Kubernetes, Vagrant, OpenShift, Apache Mesos, Deis, Mesophere DCOS).
-Docker / Microservice release orchestration including Blue Green Deployments and Canary Releases
-Managing infrastructure on Amazon AWS
-Managing infrastructure on Microsoft Azure
-Continuous Integration / Continuous Delivery software release management and automation
-Infrastructure as Code - i.e., Terraform and Cloud Formation
-MS SQL and/or MySQL administration / optimization
-NoSQL and caching tools such as MemCache / Redis
-GIT / Source Control tools (i.e., GitHub, Bit Bucket, TFS)
-Automation experience/ configuration management using either Puppet or Chef.

items.content:
BASIC FUNCTION (Primary Purpose):

Work closely with Software Engineers to help them deploy and operate different systems. Help to automate and streamline the company's operations and processes.

Scope (brief description):

We are looking for an experienced and enthusiastic DevOps Engineer. As our new DevOps Engineer, you will be in charge of the specification and documentation of the new project features. In addition, you will be developing new features and writing scripts for automation using Perl/Python/Groovy/Java/Bash.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities:

*Manage the methods of deployment (development, testing and production) and the processes and tools required to execute those deployments.
*Manage the continuous integration systems used to build digital products.
*Manage the software development tools used by the development team and ensure they are scalable and failure proof.
*Create failure management processes and tools so outages can be handled without causing a loss of delivery.
*Champion changes to tools and processes to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the development team.
*Manage issue tracking and agile development tools (Atlassian JIRA).
*Automate parts of the development delivery process using scripts and other appropriate tools.
*Document processes and user guides for integrated tools and scripts.
*Devise and develop analytical methods and tools to measure the efficiency of products and processes.
*Advise on new technologies and methodologies by becoming an expert in emerging technologies and tools.

The Individual:

Qualifications and Educational requirement(s):

*Educated to degree standard in Computer Science or (or similar engineering discipline) equivalent.
*Should have experience operating in virtual environments.
*Should have experience with both Windows and Unix based operating systems
*Must have a good knowledge of deployment and configuration technologies (e.g. gitlab, CI, ansible tower and terraform).
*Must have a good working knowledge of source control technologies (e.g.Git, subversion).
*Must have a good working knowledge of one or more scripting languages (e.g. Python, Ruby)
*A sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on the company's success
*Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
*Team player
*Good time-management skills
*Interpersonal and communication skills
*At least 3 years of professional experience

About TEKsystems:
We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call -3411 or email .com for other accommodation options.

items.content:
Junior DevOps Engineer at MailerLite

Remote | International

Job description

MailerLite is looking for a SysAdmin/DevOps engineer ready and eager to learn new things. On our team, you will work closely together with our top-notch developers.

Your responsibility will be to support and develop the infrastructure behind our rapidly growing SaaS application.

You can work from our Vilnius office or remotely from anywhere, it’s up to you! We use Slack and Basecamp to stay connected as a team.

About us

MailerLite is one of the fastest growing email marketing technologies. We help more than 600,000 businesses around the world keep in touch with their customers.

At MailerLite, we believe in keeping things simple — no corporate structure or unnecessary meetings. We have a flat organization with a team of highly-driven and talented people. Everyone on our team can pitch ideas for a new feature or propose a change and lead the project.

Our growing team of 45 people is united by enthusiasm for great products and delightful customer experiences.

We strive to build a company culture where work, socializing and personal development go hand in hand. Our culture is defined by 10 company values.

Requirements

We’re looking for a Junior SysAdmin/DevOps engineer:

  • This is a junior position and you’ll be working and learning from our Senior employees
  • You’ll be managing our bare metal and KVM platform
  • You have automation in your mind when doing redundant tasks
  • Experience with NGiNX, MySQL, PHP, Redis, ElasticSearch
  • Experience with email managing: Postfix, OpenDKIM
  • Learn, share and communicate – you’re a person that wants to learn and improve constantly
  • Good background in Linux/Unix Administration
  • As you develop, you’ll learn more about new technologies and tools like Ansible, Terraform and Kubernetes
  • Networking knowledge
  • Experience with monitoring tools
  • This position is full time (40 hours per week) and candidates located in Europe have the advantage in applying

What we offer

  • Competitive salary — we pay at or above market salary
  • Remote-first culture with half of the team in Vilnius, Lithuania and the other half working remotely from all over the world
  • Office or remote — you get to choose every day
  • Free healthy lunches, snacks and coffee in the Vilnius office
  • Company-paid retreats that we call workations. The entire team gathers twice a year in an exotic location to work, learn and have fun together for a week
  • Flexible vacation. Take time off when you need it. We trust you
  • MacBook Pro and other tools that you will need
Apply for job

items.title: Senior Development Operations Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=30, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Envato

Senior Development Operations Engineer



* Join our thriving global, online business

* Work in an environment which is unique in its scale and pace of change in Australia

* Based in our Melbourne CBD Head Office or remote (Australia wide)





Headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, we're a completely online company with an ecosystem of sites and services to help people get creative. In September 2014, one of our sites, ThemeForest, was the 90th most visited website in the world and it remains among the most visited Australian-owned website on the planet! With more than 350 staff and contractors worldwide, we've helped a community of creative sellers earn more than $500 Million.

JobAdvisor awarded us the title of Australia's Coolest Company for Women and Diversity (2015 and 2016). We were also named as one of the Best Places to Work in Australia in the 2015, 2016 and 2017 BRW Awards.

On Envato Market thousands of people earn a living selling things like WordPress themes, photos, music tracks and illustrations. With Envato Elements, we oversee one of the world’s largest subscription services for digital creatives, providing hundreds of thousands of files for unlimited download for one flat fee. We offer website design and hosting with Envato Sites. On our education platform Tuts+, over 5 million people learn skills including code, illustration, photography, web design, and more, each month. We also run a freelance marketplace called Envato Studio.

You might be surprised to know that not only do we run some of the biggest websites in the world; we’re also growing really fast!


What we’re looking for

You are comfortable with application development, scripting in various languages, as well as caring about the performance of the applications. You understand the underlying environment that your systems run on and can suggest and make changes. You can build deployment pipelines and integrate monitoring systems, and expect that deployments can happen multiple times a day without issue.

You want to support other teams to do the best work they can in the most efficient way.

You align with the goals of the DevOps movement in improving collaboration between the development and operations disciplines.

What you’ll be doing

We value people who can roll up their sleeves and get things done while keeping the big goals in sight. As a Senior Development Operations Engineer, you'll be part of a team that supports the wider engineering team to ensure the reliability, security and performance of Envato's websites. Here's a snapshot of your day-to-day:


* Supporting other teams: build and troubleshoot deployment pipelines

* Design and Build: AWS infrastructure and support tooling

* Availability: work to increase the mean-time-between-failures and decrease the mean-time-to-repair of public-facing systems

* Monitoring: contribute to the improvement of the monitoring and measurement systems that support our operational scale and continuous delivery

* Performance, Efficiency & Latency: contribute to the measurement techniques that assist in the performance tuning of the applications stack

* Security & Risk: participate in the ongoing process to identify and mitigate risks

* Support all areas of the business in day to day tasks

* Supporting a large public facing web-based application




Essential requirements


* Hands on Ruby and Ruby-on-Rails application development experience

* A commitment to continual learning

* On value with Envato’s passionate and supportive culture

* Has provided a positive contribution to both operations-focused and development-focused work

* Communicates well in person and in writing

* Has built and maintained cloud-based applications and infrastructure

* Reasonable knowledge of Linux administration

* Good understanding of monitoring and logging tools




Technologies you'll be working with


* AWS - cloudformation and tooling

* AWS RDS (Postgresql, MySQL, Aurora)

* Ruby and Ruby-on-Rails application development

* Datadog, NewRelic, Rollbar, and Logging Tools (ELK/Splunk)

* Application and Edge Caching and CDNs

* DDoS defence systems

* Ubuntu




What we offer

The challenge of scale and speed of change

As a Development Operations Engineer, you’ll be working in an environment which is unique in its scale and pace of change in Australia. The core application (written in Ruby on Rails) peaks at around 20,000 requests a minute and handles around 25 million application requests a day. Our development team will typically automatically deploy their code changes 15-20 times per day. We are deploying tested software-defined infrastructure updates many times a day.

A great team and culture


* We’re careful about hiring, and have built a team of great and diverse people

* We are all responsible for features from inception through to them being in the hands of customers. We talk directly to our customers about what they’re working on

* We actively work on creating a safe, inclusive environment free from discrimination

* Flexible working conditions – we want you to love your work but also your life outside of Envato

* We only do continuous delivery: any team member can deploy, and we regularly do several deploys a day

* We publish portions of our code as open source, and encourage contributions back to open source projects we use

* We constantly support our team to improve their craft and run regular retro and education sessions

* A fantastic culture of creatively minded, hard working people who are passionate about Envato and being part of its growth and success

* A fast paced and progressive environment where everyone has regular interaction with teammates and Envato community members from all over the world!

* Read more from our staff about why they love working at Envato by visiting www.jobadvisor.com.au/envato

* We’re offering a competitive salary package & benefits ($85k-$125k package, but flexible depending on experience)




Who should apply?

We care deeply about diversity at Envato, and welcome applicants of all types, and from all backgrounds. If you think you have the skills and experience needed for this role then we'd like to hear from you.

What next?

Submit a cover letter, an up to date copy of your resume and answers to questions in the application form. Good luck!

items.content:
Remote AWS DevOps- Automation Engineer $126,000- $131,000

Looking for individuals with experience in software development and systems operations with AWS DevOps who are hungry to expand their knowledge and contribute to new ideas pertaining to engineering autonomy. Our AWS exclusive company assists enterprises with finding the services they need to develop fundamentally secure services for faster and more consistent software and infrastructure deployments. Our goal is to provide our customers with the flexibility to be in charge of their own software to increase product functionality.
BENEFITS
  • Work remote
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Flexible schedule
  • Continuous learning opportunities
  • Part of a large distributed remote team
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Employ industry leading Continuous Delivery patterns and collaboratively work with other members to execute them to achieve successful continuous delivery solutions.
  • Collaboratively work with Senior DevOps Automation Engineers
  • AWS certified preferred but not required
We understand the importance of a work-life balance, which is why we allow our employees to work anywhere with available internet connection. Outside of any core working hours, you could be working from home, the beach, outer space or a coworking space. We value your career goals, as well as our customer's goals, and are happy to allow employees an unlimited amount of PTO. Employees are part of a large distributed remote team. In order to insure you'll never feel alone, we provide employees the tools to stay in touch and collaborate with colleagues, whether that's through simple meetings or a pair programming exercise.

REQUIREMENTS
  • Past experience demonstrating programming capability in a high-level programming language such as Ruby, Python, Java, C# or other language
  • Technical experience in either development, operations, or full-stack implementations
  • Implements successful customer engagements providing continuous delivery solutions, preferably employing AWS
  • Demonstrates Linux or Windows command-line capability
  • Familiar with core suite of AWS Services related to DevOps, with particular depth in those that are heavily used when providing DevOps Automation solutions, including the Management and Deployment services such as AWS CloudFormation, OpsWorks and IAM
  • Experience establishing and employing Continuous Integration practices and tools such as Jenkins or other CI tools
  • Frequent and comfortable use of configuration management automation tools such as Chef (or other such tools) in creating continuous delivery systems
  • AWS Certified Associate (Solutions Architect, Sys Ops, Developer). If you do not already have one or more AWS certifications, we focus on achieving that during a new engineers first 100 days on the job.
For all inquiries about this position, please contact Kayla Lozano at or [Click Here to Email Your Resum?]

Position: Senior Cloud Pipeline Engineer
Location: Remote with 25% travel
Type: Permanent
Salary: $150-170K
Sr. Cloud Pipeline Engineer - REMOTE w/ 25% Travel - $150K+
My client is a partner that is big into the digital transformation space. They pair with end users looking to transform or change their DevOps and Cloud practices. They have an exciting opportunity to bring on a new Engineer with extensive Cloud Native tools background. This person will help continue with the change they have brought to many of their clients so far. If you enjoy working heavily with Automating and Programming systems and environments, this might be the opportunity for you! This client is known for their great company culture and stellar service they provide each client. items.title: Infrastructure Engineer with Enghouse CCSP - Remote Home Based
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=42, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
COMPLETE REMOTE HOME WORKING ROLE****

CANDIDATES MUST HAVE ENGHOUSE CCSP EXPERIENCE TO BE CONSIDERED.

Reporting to the Technical Director you will be a fundamental part of the team managing the company's multi-vendor blend of IT infrastructure, with a specific focus on telephony.

Duties & Responsibilities

* Design, deployment and support of the company contact centre platform, session border controllers and associated telephony systems

* Design, deployment and support of the company Windows servers farm, virtualisation and storage systems

* Troubleshooting of complex IT infrastructure problems with vendor escalation and Problem ownership through to resolution

* Monitoring and performance tuning of IT infrastructure to minimise any business disruption time and SLA adherence

* Design, deployment and management of information security policies in alignment with ISO27001 standards

* Development of technical documentation, internal standards and reports as requested by management

* Research, evaluate and recommend new technology solutions to address emerging industry and technical needs

* 5+ years of experience and in-depth knowledge of Microsoft Architecture in high availability contact centre / VoIP environments

* Ability to perform effectively as a subject matter expert within your area of telephony and as a team player

* Mentor, coach and impart knowledge to junior team members with minimal supervision

Knowledge and Experience

* Enghouse CCSP Contact Centre platform

* Sonus session border controller platform

* MCSE, CCNP and/or CCVP Voice

* SIP Gateways and Trunking

* Windows Server 2008 /2012

* Active Directory

* Group Policies and their application for Security best practice

* Virtualisation Technologies (ESXi)

* SAN / NAS Storage Technologies

* MS SQL Server 2008 / 2012

* Microsoft Exchange 2010/ 2013

* ISA Server & Firewall Configuration

* Windows debugging tools (WinDBG, Sysinternals tools)

* DNS, DHCP, SMTP, SNMP

* HP / Dell Hardware and monitoring tools

* Information security best practice

* Windows Scripting (Batch, VBScript, Powershell)

Other Personal Attributes

* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

* Adaptability, assertiveness and resilience

* Ability to handle stressful situations

* Flexibility in your working hours

Working Hours & Environment

This is a full-time role based from home from with some occasional travel requirements. The working hours will be 09:00 - 17:30 from Monday to Friday, however you may be required to work outside of these hours to support the business as required.

Technology and Home Office Requirements

You will need to provide a quiet and secluded home office equipped with a dedicated telephone line, a dedicated wired broadband connection, a dedicated to work PC (desktop) with at least 2 screens, a PC headset and a telephone handset with headset, all meeting our required specifications.

You will not be moving home within the next 6 months.

Pre-Employment Checks

We will conduct the following background checks:

* Legal right to work in the UK

* Proof of address

* Past five years activity

* Criminal history check (DBS basic disclosure)

* Fraud database checks

* Adverse financial check (County Court Judgements, Bankruptcy and Individual Voluntary Arrangements)

AAP3 is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy

items.title: MailerLite: Junior DevOps Engineer
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, anywher, base, resid) 7W OR(europ, european, europeanunion)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Junior DevOps Engineer

Job description

MailerLite is looking for a SysAdmin/DevOps engineer ready and eager to learn new things. On our team, you will work closely together with our top-notch developers.

Your responsibility will be to support and develop the infrastructure behind our rapidly growing SaaS application.

You can work from our Vilnius office or remotely from anywhere, it's up to you! We use Slack and Basecamp to stay connected as a team.

About us

MailerLite is one of the fastest growing email marketing technologies. We help more than 600,000 businesses around the world keep in touch with their customers.
At MailerLite, we believe in keeping things simple — no corporate structure or unnecessary meetings. We have a flat organization with a team of highly-driven and talented people. Everyone on our team can pitch ideas for a new feature or propose a change and lead the project.

Our growing team of 45 people is united by enthusiasm for great products and delightful customer experiences.

We strive to build a company culture where work, socializing and personal development go hand in hand. Our culture is defined by 10 company values.

Requirements

We're looking for an Junior SysAdmin/DevOps engineer:

  • This is a junior position and you'll be working and learning from our Senior employees
  • You'll be managing our bare metal and KVM platform
  • You have automation in your mind when doing redundant tasks
  • Experience with NGiNX, MySQL, PHP, Redis, ElasticSearch
  • Experience with email managing: Postfix, OpenDKIM
  • Learn, share and communicate - you're a person that wants to learn and improve constantly
  • Good background in Linux/Unix Administration
  • As you develop, you'll learn more about new technologies and tools like Ansible, Terraform and Kubernetes
  • Networking knowledge
  • Experience with monitoring tools
  • This position is full time (40 hours per week) and candidates located in Europe have the advantage in applying

What we offer

  • Competitive salary — we pay at or above market salary
  • Remote-first culture with half of the team in Vilnius, Lithuania and the other half working remotely from all over the world
  • Office or remote — you get to choose every day
  • Free healthy lunches, snacks and coffee in the Vilnius office
  • Company-paid retreats that we call workations. The entire team gathers twice a year in an exotic location to work, learn and have fun together for a week
  • Flexible vacation. Take time off when you need it. We trust you
  • MacBook Pro and other tools that you will need

Interested?

Don't send us your resume. We like to do things differently.

Instead, here is how we would like you to apply:

  1. Sign up for a free MailerLite account
  2. Create a newsletter about yourself and send it to jobs@mailerlite.com
Before you send the email, you will need your new account to be approved. In the approval form, you will be asked how you collect subscribers and what type of content you plan to send. Just write "Job application."

Or, simply send us the url of your newsletter in your application email.

Things we would love to see in the newsletter:

  • Links to your Linkedin, GitHuB, StackOverflow, Twitter, Facebook or personal homepage
  • Companies you've worked at and your position within the company
  • Why you want to join MailerLite
  • Describe a project or product that you loved working on and why
  • Expected salary
We're excited to meet you! Good luck.

items.title: DNSimple: System Administrator
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=5, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
System Administrator

As a DNSimple System Administrator, you are responsible for maintaining and enhancing our mixed bare metal & VM based infrastructure, fixing issues, automating tasks and routines, and developing an overall system to help achieve customer success through the automation of their domain management.

System Administration Team:

  • We are a fully distributed team of experienced system administrators.
  • We use Chef-Infra to manage and Chef-Inspec to test our system changes.
  • We deploy and operate our various applications and infrastructure.
  • We update and use our documentation rigorously to keep runbooks up to date.
  • We automate wherever possible, removing manual procedures wherever we can.
  • We test our code, we use code review, and we ship multiple times a day.

Responsibilities:

  • Build, maintain, & enhance the infrastructure for our applications and dependencies.
  • Update and clarify documentation, incident handling, and operational procedures.
  • Communicate progress on projects with the DNSimple team through GitHub & Trello.
  • Review other team members pull requests in a timely fashion.
  • Answer customer support requests, helping customers achieve their goals and recording issues when changes need to be made to handle bugs or enhancements.

Skills:

  • Strong English comprehension and writing skills.
  • Previous experience using Chef, Ubuntu, and PostgreSQL.
  • Linux networking and software controlled BGP experience is preferred.
  • Experience with Docker or similar container packaging is preferred.
  • Experience with Go, Ruby, or Erlang is a bonus.

items.content:
Senior Development Operations Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: System Administrator
Industry: eLearning, Information Technology, Online Media
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private
Company: Envato | Melbourne, Australia

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+11:00) Eastern Time - Melbourne, Sydney
Office Location: Melbourne, Australia. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Visa Sponsorship: Yes
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

amazon-web-services
ruby-on-rails-4
datadog
amazon-cloudformation
sysadmin

Job description

  • Join our thriving global, online business
  • Work in an environment which is unique in its scale and pace of change in Australia
  • Based in our Melbourne CBD Head Office or remote (Australia wide)

Headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, we're a completely online company with an ecosystem of sites and services to help people get creative. In September 2014, one of our sites, ThemeForest, was the 90th most visited website in the world and it remains among the most visited Australian-owned website on the planet! With more than 350 staff and contractors worldwide, we've helped a community of creative sellers earn more than $500 Million.

JobAdvisor awarded us the title of Australia's Coolest Company for Women and Diversity (2015 and 2016). We were also named as one of the Best Places to Work in Australia in the 2015, 2016 and 2017 BRW Awards.

On Envato Market thousands of people earn a living selling things like WordPress themes, photos, music tracks and illustrations. With Envato Elements, we oversee one of the world’s largest subscription services for digital creatives, providing hundreds of thousands of files for unlimited download for one flat fee. We offer website design and hosting with Envato Sites. On our education platform Tuts+, over 5 million people learn skills including code, illustration, photography, web design, and more, each month. We also run a freelance marketplace called Envato Studio.

You might be surprised to know that not only do we run some of the biggest websites in the world; we’re also growing really fast!

What we’re looking for

You are comfortable with application development, scripting in various languages, as well as caring about the performance of the applications. You understand the underlying environment that your systems run on and can suggest and make changes. You can build deployment pipelines and integrate monitoring systems, and expect that deployments can happen multiple times a day without issue.

You want to support other teams to do the best work they can in the most efficient way.

You align with the goals of the DevOps movement in improving collaboration between the development and operations disciplines.

What you’ll be doing

We value people who can roll up their sleeves and get things done while keeping the big goals in sight. As a Senior Development Operations Engineer, you'll be part of a team that supports the wider engineering team to ensure the reliability, security and performance of Envato's websites. Here's a snapshot of your day-to-day:

  • Supporting other teams: build and troubleshoot deployment pipelines
  • Design and Build: AWS infrastructure and support tooling
  • Availability: work to increase the mean-time-between-failures and decrease the mean-time-to-repair of public-facing systems
  • Monitoring: contribute to the improvement of the monitoring and measurement systems that support our operational scale and continuous delivery
  • Performance, Efficiency & Latency: contribute to the measurement techniques that assist in the performance tuning of the applications stack
  • Security & Risk: participate in the ongoing process to identify and mitigate risks
  • Support all areas of the business in day to day tasks
  • Supporting a large public facing web-based application

Essential requirements

  • Hands on Ruby and Ruby-on-Rails application development experience
  • A commitment to continual learning
  • On value with Envato’s passionate and supportive culture
  • Has provided a positive contribution to both operations-focused and development-focused work
  • Communicates well in person and in writing
  • Has built and maintained cloud-based applications and infrastructure
  • Reasonable knowledge of Linux administration
  • Good understanding of monitoring and logging tools

Technologies you'll be working with

  • AWS - cloudformation and tooling
  • AWS RDS (Postgresql, MySQL, Aurora)
  • Ruby and Ruby-on-Rails application development
  • Datadog, NewRelic, Rollbar, and Logging Tools (ELK/Splunk)
  • Application and Edge Caching and CDNs
  • DDoS defence systems
  • Ubuntu

What we offer

The challenge of scale and speed of change

As a Development Operations Engineer, you’ll be working in an environment which is unique in its scale and pace of change in Australia. The core application (written in Ruby on Rails) peaks at around 20,000 requests a minute and handles around 25 million application requests a day. Our development team will typically automatically deploy their code changes 15-20 times per day. We are deploying tested software-defined infrastructure updates many times a day.

A great team and culture

  • We’re careful about hiring, and have built a team of great and diverse people
  • We are all responsible for features from inception through to them being in the hands of customers. We talk directly to our customers about what they’re working on
  • We actively work on creating a safe, inclusive environment free from discrimination
  • Flexible working conditions – we want you to love your work but also your life outside of Envato
  • We only do continuous delivery: any team member can deploy, and we regularly do several deploys a day
  • We publish portions of our code as open source, and encourage contributions back to open source projects we use
  • We constantly support our team to improve their craft and run regular retro and education sessions
  • A fantastic culture of creatively minded, hard working people who are passionate about Envato and being part of its growth and success
  • A fast paced and progressive environment where everyone has regular interaction with teammates and Envato community members from all over the world!
  • Read more from our staff about why they love working at Envato by visiting www.jobadvisor.com.au/envato
  • We’re offering a competitive salary package & benefits ($85k-$125k package, but flexible depending on experience)

Who should apply?

We care deeply about diversity at Envato, and welcome applicants of all types, and from all backgrounds. If you think you have the skills and experience needed for this role then we'd like to hear from you.

What next?

Submit a cover letter, an up to date copy of your resume and answers to questions in the application form. Good luck!

Apply now

About Envato

Headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, we're a completely online company with an ecosystem of sites and services to help people get creative. In September 2014, one of our sites, ThemeForest, was the 90th most visited website in the world and it remains among the most visited Australian-owned website on the planet! With more than 350 staff and contractors worldwide, we've helped a community of creative sellers earn more than $500 Million.

JobAdvisor awarded us the title of Australia's Coolest Company for Women and Diversity (2015 and 2016). We were also named as one of the Best Places to Work in Australia in the 2015, 2016 and 2017BRW Awards.

On Envato Market thousands of people earn a living selling things like WordPress themes, photos, music tracks and illustrations. With Envato Elements, we oversee one of the world’s largest subscription services for digital creatives, providing hundreds of thousands of files for unlimited download for one flat fee. We offer website design and hosting with Envato Sites. On our education platform Tuts+, over 5 million people learn skills including code, illustration, photography, web design, and more, each month. We also run a freelance marketplace called Envato Studio.

You might be surprised to know that not only do we run some of the biggest websites in the world; we’re also growing really fast!

All applicants will be considered for all open engineering roles across Envato (Market, Tuts+, Studio, Elements etc.)

Benefits

  • Remote Work Options: in Australia or up to 3 months per year worldwide
  • 2 Hack Forts per year: each running for 2 weeks
  • Flexible Work Options: work from home one or more days per week
  • Flexible Hours: core business hours of 10am to 4pm
  • Great Parental Leave: up to 18 weeks at full pay
  • Training/Development: including conference attendance, books and more
  • Regular Performance Reviews: peers and manager
  • Extra Holidays: buy 2 weeks additional leave after 12 months
  • Volunteer Day: We offer a volunteer day for each employee per year
  • Free Netball & Yoga

items.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=1, dotnet=48, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Olo

Senior Devops Engineer


At Olo we develop an online food ordering platform used by many of the country’s largest restaurant chains, reaching millions of consumers. Chances are if you’ve ordered directly from a restaurant brand’s app or website, we’ve made that happen. Mobile ordering and payments is an exciting and active industry full of interesting players and yet still a relatively untapped market ripe for disruption. We’re quite up-front about the technical challenges our business faces. Running a platform with multiple white-labeled front-ends, that maintains real-time connections into thousands of restaurants’ POS systems, and coordinates complex transactions between these and other third parties (such as payment gateways and gift card providers) is not for the faint of heart!

You’ll be joining our Infrastructure Team, responsible for keeping Olo’s food ordering and delivery systems up and running reliably and securely.

Our DevOps-oriented team uses Infrastructure-as-Code with automation wherever possible. The system has many moving parts and frequent deployments.

Any engineer may work at Olo’s headquarters in New York City’s Financial District or remotely from anywhere in the U.S. In fact, more than half of our engineering team is remote!

Responsibilities


* Building virtual infrastructure in cloud platforms such as AWS using Infrastructure as Code and tools such as Terraform and Ansible

* Creating and Reviewing Pull requests for configuration updates and  server provisioning

* Assist in designing and maintaining build pipelines for Olo applications and infrastructure

* Patching operating system and security related vulnerabilities

* Configuring Load Balancers, VPCs, and Security Groups

* Proactively monitoring all systems for uptime and security. Noticing trends before they become issues. Improving Monitoring infrastructure as needed

* Responding to PagerDuty alerts as part of an on-call rotation with another engineer.

* Administering Windows and Linux Servers




Required Skills/Experience


* At least 3 years of production level experience supporting a 24/7 web application in a devops role

* In-depth production level experience with AWS services and APIs

* Comfortable in your scripting tool of choice - PowerShell, Python, Bash etc.

* Working knowledge of DevOps, automation, and Infrastructure as Code

* Experience designing and creating build pipelines (TeamCity, Jenkins, Octopus)

* Solid networking knowledge, VPCs, Security Groups, and capable of troubleshooting all types of network traffic issues

* Experience using server provisioning software such as Ansible, Chef or Puppet

* Comfort working with Linux and Windows servers

* A passion for uptime




Beneficial


* Expert level Windows Server knowledge, including IIS, Active Directory, WSUS, SQL, Windows Server Failover Cluster and Windows Networking

* In-depth knowledge of Apache Kafka

* Experience using container and orchestration tools such as Docker and Kubernetes

* PCI compliance experience

* Started your career as a software developer





About Olo

Olo is the on-demand interface for the restaurant industry, powering digital ordering and delivery for over 250 restaurant brands. Olo’s enterprise-grade software powers every stage of the digital restaurant transaction, from fully-branded user interfaces to the back-of-house order management features that keep the kitchen running smoothly. Orders from Olo are injected seamlessly into existing restaurant systems to help brands capture demand from on-demand channels such as branded website and apps, third-party marketplaces, social media channels, and personal assistant devices like the Amazon Echo. Olo is a pioneer in the industry, beginning with text message ordering on mobile feature phones in 2005. Today, millions of consumers use Olo to order ahead (SKIP THE LINE®) or get meals delivered from the restaurants they love. Customers include Applebee’s, Chili’s, Chipotle, Denny’s, Five Guys Burgers & Fries, Jamba Juice, Noodles & Company, Red Robin, Shake Shack, sweetgreen, Wingstop, and more.

Olo’s office is located at One World Trade Center in Manhattan. We offer great benefits, such as 20 days of Paid Time Off, fully paid health, dental and vision care premiums, stock options, a generous parental leave plan, and perks like FitBits, rotating craft beers on tap in our kitchen, and food events featuring our clients' menu items (now you know why we give out FitBits!). Check out our culture map: https://www.olo.com/images/culture.jpg.

We encourage you to apply!

At Olo, we know a diverse and inclusive team not only makes our products better, but our workplace better. Many groups are consistently underrepresented across the tech sector and we are fully committed in doing our part to move the needle.

Olo is an equal opportunity employer and diversity is highly valued at our company. All applicants receive consideration for employment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

If you like what you read, hear, and/or know about Olo, and want to be a part of our team, please do not hesitate to apply! We are excited to hear from you!

items.content:
Expanding access toaffordable, high quality health care starts here. This is where some of themost innovative ideas in health care are created every day. This is where boldpeople with big ideas are writing the next chapter in health care. This is theplace to do your life's best work.(sm)


This creative roleoffers an excellent opportunity to directly impact an innovative function andsecure your future with an industry leader. The Senior Network PricingConsultant supports and validates physician incentive / performance basedcontracting activities through financial and network pricing modeling,analysis, and reporting. The individual in this role will travel to provider locationsin the assigned territory to present / discuss financials, as well asthe data points that explain the financial results.





PrimaryResponsibilities:

  • Develop, monitor and evolve the payment incentive model
  • Work independently and interact with external constituencies
  • Provide data analysis, contract auditing and metrics reporting to management
  • Perform reconciliations to determine if physicians have met contractual obligations
  • Translate highly complex concepts in ways that can be understood by a variety of audiences
  • Advocate for best economics internally and externally
  • Develop, analyze and monitor new, routine and ad hoc reports
  • Predict emerging customer needs and develop innovative solutions to meet them
  • Solve unique and complex problems with broad impact on the business
  • Develop and manage business plans to achieve objectives
  • Influence senior leadership to adopt new ideas, products, and / or approaches
  • NOTE: Travel to Providers in Northeast is a requirement
  • Role is office based in CT, RI



Required Qualifications:
  • Bachelor-s degree or higher
  • 4+ years of analytical experience in financial analysis, healthcare pricing, network management, healthcare economics, or related discipline
  • 4+ years of experience with provider payment methodologies and healthcare products
  • Advanced level of proficiency in performing financial impact analysis, risk management, and data manipulation
  • 4+ years of experience in creating and using financial modeling tools, spreadsheets, and information acquisition tools including experience in interpreting and reviewing financial modeling results to evaluate the financial impact of contract changes and develop forecasts
  • Advanced level proficiency in MS Excel
  • Client facing experience
  • Must live within commutable distance of one of the office locations listed in the job posting. These locations area CT, RI


PreferredQualifications:

  • Experience with relational databases (Oracle, SQL Server, SAS)
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • ACO Experience


Careers at UnitedHealthcare Employer &Individual. We all want to make adifference with the work we do. Sometimes we're presented with an opportunityto make a difference on a scale we couldn't imagine. Here, you get thatopportunity every day. As a member of one of our elite teams, you'll providethe ideas and solutions that help nearly 25 million customers live healthierlives. You'll help write the next chapter in the history of health care. Andyou'll find a wealth of open doors and career paths that will take you as faras you want to go. Go further. This is your life's best work.(sm)


*All Telecommuters willbe required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group-s Telecommuter Policy.



Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is anEqual Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and all qualifiedapplicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disabilitystatus, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status,genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.


UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates arerequired to pass a drug test before beginning employment.



Job Keywords: HealthcareEconomics, Network Pricing, Medical Economics, Healthcare Analyst, FinancialAnalyst, Sales Contracts Analyst, Pricing Consultant, Shelton, CT, Hartford,CT, Trumbull, CT, Connecticut, RI, Rhode Island
- provided by Dice

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=1, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
AWS, Heroku, SALT, Ansible, Terraform, Postgres, Python, RUBY, Bash, RabbitMQ

If you are a DevOps / Site Reliability Engineer with experience, please read on!

We're located in sunny Southern California however we're looking for an experienced DevOps candidate to join our team - we allow 100% remote!! We're a technology/health company that is bridging the gap with user data to determine health behavior and needs. We received our Series C funding and we're ready to ramp up our team and product.

We offer great benefits including health, dental, and vision for your and your dependents; we also offer a relaxed and flexible work environment to accommodate any of the hiccups that life throws your way. Applications are reviewed and processed quickly - please apply today if you are interested.

**Application will be considered incomplete unless screening questions are answered; incomplete applications cannot be submitted for further review. Please answer all screening questions in detail in order to expedite the process.**

What You Will Be Doing

- Solving complex technical problems
- Working on product architecture and scalability of distributed systems

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=1, dotnet=56, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior DevOps Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: DevOps
Industry: E-Commerce, Mobile, Software Development
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Olo | No office location

Technologies

windows
amazon-web-services
Greg Shackles 9.3k 1 23 34
Lars A. Brekken 9.3k 3 21 26
Mike Devaney
Bret Koppel

Job description

At Olo we develop an online food ordering platform used by many of the country’s largest restaurant chains, reaching millions of consumers. Chances are if you’ve ordered directly from a restaurant brand’s app or website, we’ve made that happen. Mobile ordering and payments is an exciting and active industry full of interesting players and yet still a relatively untapped market ripe for disruption. We’re quite up-front about the technical challenges our business faces. Running a platform with multiple white-labeled front-ends, that maintains real-time connections into thousands of restaurants’ POS systems, and coordinates complex transactions between these and other third parties (such as payment gateways and gift card providers) is not for the faint of heart!

You’ll be joining our Infrastructure Team, responsible for keeping Olo’s food ordering and delivery systems up and running reliably and securely.

Our DevOps-oriented team uses Infrastructure-as-Code with automation wherever possible. The system has many moving parts and frequent deployments.

Any engineer may work at Olo’s headquarters in New York City’s Financial District or remotely from anywhere in the U.S. In fact, more than half of our engineering team is remote!

Responsibilities

  • Building virtual infrastructure in cloud platforms such as AWS using Infrastructure as Code and tools such as Terraform and Ansible
  • Creating and Reviewing Pull requests for configuration updates and  server provisioning
  • Assist in designing and maintaining build pipelines for Olo applications and infrastructure
  • Patching operating system and security related vulnerabilities
  • Configuring Load Balancers, VPCs, and Security Groups
  • Proactively monitoring all systems for uptime and security. Noticing trends before they become issues. Improving Monitoring infrastructure as needed
  • Responding to PagerDuty alerts as part of an on-call rotation with another engineer.
  • Administering Windows and Linux Servers

Required Skills/Experience

  • At least 3 years of production level experience supporting a 24/7 web application in a devops role
  • In-depth production level experience with AWS services and APIs
  • Comfortable in your scripting tool of choice - PowerShell, Python, Bash etc.
  • Working knowledge of DevOps, automation, and Infrastructure as Code
  • Experience designing and creating build pipelines (TeamCity, Jenkins, Octopus)
  • Solid networking knowledge, VPCs, Security Groups, and capable of troubleshooting all types of network traffic issues
  • Experience using server provisioning software such as Ansible, Chef or Puppet
  • Comfort working with Linux and Windows servers
  • A passion for uptime

Beneficial

  • Expert level Windows Server knowledge, including IIS, Active Directory, WSUS, SQL, Windows Server Failover Cluster and Windows Networking
  • In-depth knowledge of Apache Kafka
  • Experience using container and orchestration tools such as Docker and Kubernetes
  • PCI compliance experience
  • Started your career as a software developer

About Olo

Olo is the on-demand interface for the restaurant industry, powering digital ordering and delivery for over 250 restaurant brands. Olo’s enterprise-grade software powers every stage of the digital restaurant transaction, from fully-branded user interfaces to the back-of-house order management features that keep the kitchen running smoothly. Orders from Olo are injected seamlessly into existing restaurant systems to help brands capture demand from on-demand channels such as branded website and apps, third-party marketplaces, social media channels, and personal assistant devices like the Amazon Echo. Olo is a pioneer in the industry, beginning with text message ordering on mobile feature phones in 2005. Today, millions of consumers use Olo to order ahead (SKIP THE LINE®) or get meals delivered from the restaurants they love. Customers include Applebee’s, Chili’s, Chipotle, Denny’s, Five Guys Burgers & Fries, Jamba Juice, Noodles & Company, Red Robin, Shake Shack, sweetgreen, Wingstop, and more.

Olo’s office is located at One World Trade Center in Manhattan. We offer great benefits, such as 20 days of Paid Time Off, fully paid health, dental and vision care premiums, stock options, a generous parental leave plan, and perks like FitBits, rotating craft beers on tap in our kitchen, and food events featuring our clients' menu items (now you know why we give out FitBits!). Check out our culture map: https://www.olo.com/images/culture.jpg.

We encourage you to apply!

At Olo, we know a diverse and inclusive team not only makes our products better, but our workplace better. Many groups are consistently underrepresented across the tech sector and we are fully committed in doing our part to move the needle.

Olo is an equal opportunity employer and diversity is highly valued at our company. All applicants receive consideration for employment. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

If you like what you read, hear, and/or know about Olo, and want to be a part of our team, please do not hesitate to apply! We are excited to hear from you!

Apply now

About Olo

We're quite up-front about the technical challenges our business faces. Our platform enables multiple white-labeled front-ends, maintains real-time connections into thousands of restaurants' POS systems, and coordinates complex transactions between these and other third parties (such as payment gateways and gift card providers). Running such a platform is not for the faint of heart.

Mobile ordering and payments is an exciting and active industry, full of interesting players and yet still a relatively untapped market ripe for disruption. 

We have a relatively small team of smart, senior engineers who all get along. 

We're super DevOps oriented and like to automate and build tools for everything. We use Continuous Integration and push frequently. 

We dedicate time to refactoring to reduce technical debt and to introduce newer technologies. We encourage new ideas and experimentation. No part of the codebase is off-limits.

Came here for the pizza coding test? Check out our open jobs and we'll send you the test post-application!

Benefits

  • 20 Days of PTO
  • Health, Vision & Dental coverage (you + your family)
  • Flexible working hours
  • Competitive Compensation Package
  • Powerful workstations
  • 401(k) Plan
  • Maximum respect
  • Food events & monthly team events
  • 12 week paid parental leave

items.title: Remote Technical Operations
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Flyt is a technology platform designed to help the world’s top food delivery companies to work with the largest restaurant partners seamlessly. If you have ordered food through any of the major delivery partners you would have touched our technology with us being the technical backbone for these partners.

Today, we’re a global company, with our technology being deployed across Europe, North America and Australia, and with team members in six countries. Yet we’re still human-scale: we’re a company where everyone can get to know everyone, and are structured to ensure every multidisciplinary team has a strong sense of community, and complete autonomy on how to hit their goals.

Flyt is organised in small, cross functional autonomous teams, we call squads. Each one of our squads owns an area of the product end-to-end and is responsible for meeting a business goal. Same principles as the spotify model, but customised to what works for us.

 

The Role

  • We’re looking for a Technical Operations Officer to support the squad responsible for deploying multiple Point Of Sale (POS) integration projects globally.
  • You’ll optimise processes to ensure we’re able to run faster to achieve our deployment goals.
  • You’ll have a clear view of what needs to be completed across all projects before go-live and understand how your individual contribution adds value to what the squad delivers.
  • As a critical component of a cross-functional squad, you’ll be outcome-focused and use your initiative to suggest new ways of working.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Menu curation - building menu information from various source formats (e.g. excel/PDF/JSON files etc.)
  • Menu mapping across different systems
  • Merchant on-baording: account set-up, location on-boarding etc.
  • Creating testing scripts for the pilot go-live
  • End to end testing of the menu, price bands, orders etc.
  • Resolving discrepancies in information/ obtaining further information for incomplete documents
  • Active participation in weekly project meetings to understand the “why” of the work you’re undertaking
  • Preparing and sorting documents for data entry
  • Updating existing data upon customer request

 

About you

We’re confident you’ll love working here if:

  • You want to get into the trenches with a collaborative team.
  • You want to help deliver innovative software products.
  • You class yourself as a continuous improver, and constantly push yourself outside of your comfort zone.
  • You like to openly communicate, be willing to listen to peers and give and receive continuous feedback.

BENEFITS

  • Remote Working
  • £22,000 - £26,000
  • Bonus Pool
  • A great working environment, regular office events and a culture of creating unique experiences for our employees
  • Macbook pro - top spec.
  • The training you need to help you level-up (up to £1,000/y)
  • The opportunity to work in a fast-growing company with global expansion plans and operations spanning USA, UK, and Australia.
  • Pension - 3% matched to 5%
  • 25 days holiday
  • Cycle to work scheme – www.cyclescheme.co.uk

Scope: The Sponsor seeks expertise in the analysis, research and drafting of Requirements Traceability Matrices (RTMs).

Functional Duties/Responsibilities:
Plan, document and tracks deliverables to provide end-to-end project management support through the RTM development life cycle; demonstrate a technical understanding of relationships, dependencies and requirements of systems or subsystems; Coordinate with team members and across projects to ensures problem solution, appropriate risk reduction, and user satisfaction; research and evaluate relevant documentation, such as the Operations Concept and the Capabilities Development Document: assist with developing and maintaining detailed schedules for assigned projects to include tracking status of all project activities against the master schedule baseline; assist in the preparation and delivery of formal and informal briefings that demonstrate the depth of understanding of the task at hand and that provide information about proposed solutions or alternatives for satisfying the task requirements.

Required Education: BS Physics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or applicable engineering or science field.

Required Experience:

  • 10 years of progressive functional experience related to the technical area in a professional work environment.
  • Experience working with DoD agencies.
  • Understanding and experience working with the Joint Capabilities and Development System (JCIDS); Requirements Decomposition; Requirements Traceability related to DoD acquisitions programs and overarching requirements.
  • Ability to lead meetings attended by government and industry personnel.
  • Experience working with/using DOORS.

Preferred Experience:

  • Experience working with Integrated Master Schedules.
  • DAWIA Level II certification (or civilian equivalent) in engineering or test.

Security Clearance: Active Secret Clearance; or ability to obtain a DoD Secret security clearance within 90 days of hire date.

Additional Information: This is a 4-month full-time seasonal opportunity with the potential for follow-on work. Remote work will be considered on a case-by case basis.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior DevOps Engineer

United Kingdom, London
Company: Worldpay

Overview

Why is our DevOps Core Engineering team the next step for you?

Worldpay is continuing to invest heavily in its Engineering capabilities with agile development teams spread across the UK, Romania, America and India. We drive continual improvement (kaizen) and are always looking to remove waste, risk or inefficiency from the entire SDLC so that our teams can reach their full potential. Key to this is our adoption of the DevOps mind-set across all stakeholders – not just the development teams!

In order to realise this strategy, Worldpay runs a centralised team that provide the core DevOps capabilities required by the organisation (the DOCET team). The team designs, builds, tests, releases and supports our CI/CD pipeline which is used by engineering teams to build and deploy production applications to on- and off-premise environments including public clouds (AWS). Containers are a vital part of this architecture.

Most important of all – we believe that DevOps is a culture, not a team. As such members of the team are expected to evangelise our DevOps capabilities; helping other teams help themselves and always looking to empower stakeholders through self-service tooling. Our vision is a lightning-fast distributed development capability, constantly delivering business value and sharing solutions for the benefit of all.

How will you contribute on a day-to-day basis?

An opportunity has arisen for a Senior DevOps Engineer to join this team and assist in building the future of Worldpay’s delivery pipeline. You will work alongside other talented engineers to determine how best to meet the requirements of the business, and then turning that into a reliable, scalable and supported pipeline used by agile development teams across different business areas and geographical locations.
As a senior member of the team you will be expected to engage with stakeholders, provide technical leadership both within the team and to development teams starting on the DevOps journey, and should expect to take ownership for one or more of the tools that the team support.

What will make you the right fit for the team?

You will have extensive DevOps engineering and tools experience, as well as solid understanding of DevOps and Middleware implementations. Previous experience in DevOps design, engineering, implementation and support from a financial services organisation is ideal, and you will have experience with many of the following: CI/ CD pipelining, Ansible, Puppet, Chef High Availability and Disaster Recovery, Capacity Planning and Backup, Windows and Linux Administration, Application, Systems and Network Troubleshooting, Runbook Automation and Scripting, Application Performance Monitoring and Root Cause Analysis, Software Development Lifecycle, Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Amazon Web Service (AWS), User and Process Documentation, Unit, Performance and Integration Testing.

You will have the ability to build strong relationships with business and technology stakeholders through open and honest dialogue. Knowledge of payment applications and services are ideal.

How is Worldpay changing the world?

Worldpay has merged with Vantiv Inc. to create a new global leader in payments. The new Worldpay will have the scale, the reach and the resources to take our success story to another level. This move allows us to expand further into high growth markets, deliver innovation at scale and above all, brings together exceptional talent and a shared passion that will help propel us forward to the next chapter of our collective story.

Our technology enables billions of payments to be made each year whether online or in person. Working with customers large and small we help them to take payments quickly, safely and reliably, allowing them to grow their businesses and making your life more convenient in the process.

Apply for job

items.content:
A Lead DevOps Engineer sought after by Shoreditch based FinTech company where remote working and flexibility is encouraged throughout.

Does complexity of both data and visualisation appeal? This opportunity would see you evaluating and selecting appropriate infrastructure solutions and seamlessly integrating them. Hand on and leading from the front you will work with AWS (Linux and Windows) using Terraform, Packer, Kubernetes and much more.

Reporting directly into the board, you not only build the infrastructure but also a grow a team and strategy to go with.

Innovation is key and as such, the stack is changing. Our client are moving away from a monolithic n-tier architecture towards microservices and embracing server less where it fits. As lead Engineer you will contribute to the design, build and operational management of highly scalable, secure and available infrastructure. As Lead, you will contribute to improve the company's ability to deliver applications and services at high velocity: evolving and improving products at a faster pace using tools and automation to continuously improve our software development/deployment and infrastructure management processes.

AWS, HAProxy, Terraform, Terraform Enterprise, Powershell, Packer, SumoLogic, AlertLogic, TeamCity, Octopus, SauceLab, Sentry, Grafana, New Relic, Serverless, Windows Servers, Linux, Kubernetes and more.

Client interviewing immediately. Please apply now.

items.title: Juniper Network Engineer II - REMOTE
items.content:
Juniper Consultant

Location: Lincolnshire, IL

Selling Point:

This project does not start until (July end) will last for 6 months to 1 year. Must be Juniper JNCIE-DC certified. This is a support and troubleshooting role not an architect role. NSX is a plus would prefer local to drive in to meeting 2 times a month but open to remote with 10% travel.

We have a project with a client who owns two very large Juniper Data Centers. We need a resource for 6 months to a year that can assist with the daily support the Juniper Network infrastructure as the client migrates from NSX-V into NSX-t (NSX is out of the scope, but previous experience integrating Juniper and NSX is a plus)

  • Juniper MX480, and MX240
  • EVPN, VXLAN, MP-BGP
  • MPLS-Based Layer 3 VPNs

items.content:
Senior System Administrator

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Business Process Optmization, Business Process Outsourcing, Information Technology
Company size: 10k+ people
Company type: Private

Reactions to this job

0 0 0 0 0 0
New! How do you feel about this job listing?
Company: Capita plc | Antrim, UK

Remote details

Office Location: Antrim, UK. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

sysadmin

Job description



Becoming a Senior Systems Administrator with Capita IT & Networks:

Capita IT & Networks are currently on the market to recruit a Senior Systems Administrator. As a member of our 3rd Line Support team you will form part of the escalation structure for all technical support issues relating to infrastructure across a wide range of customer environments.

You will act as a key point of contact for the other tiers of support in both receiving escalations and where appropriate providing guidance and instruction.



What you will do:

As a member of the Service Delivery team you will:
  • Providing a point for technical escalation a range of technologies associated with IaaS and hosting services
  • Management and support of a wide variety of customer environments, responding to reported incidents (both proactive and reactive) and driving resolution to meet agreed SLA's
  • Take ownership of and lead technical engagements around complex change and Major Incidents
  • Identify and drive pro-active service improvement
  • Provide peer review of designs and solutions
  • Participation in an on-call rota to provide out of hours support
  • Escalation of technical issues with 3rd parties/vendors via agreed support mechanisms and progressing to resolution
  • Identification and escalation of (potential) service issues with designated Service Delivery/Account/Client management
  • Execution of operational maintenance tasks
  • Ensuring that services are appropriately documented
  • Work as part of a technical team providing support and guidance where appropriate. Provide mentoring for other members of the team
  • Interact directly with clients in a courteous and professional manner
  • Identify areas of continuous improvement, providing suggestions for their introduction




About you:
  • Strong knowledge & experience in:
    • Microsoft Windows server operating systems up to and including Server 2016
    • Microsoft Windows domain infrastructure design, components, structures and principles
    • Support and administration of hypervisor solutions, including VMWare ESXi and Microsoft Hyper-V
  • Working experience and understanding of:
    • Support and administration of backup solutions, including one or more from the following: Backup Exec, Commvault, Netbackup, Dell Networker, Veeam
    • Support and administration of Anti-Virus solutions, in particular McAfee and Symantec products
    • Support and administration of mail and messaging, including one or more from the following: Exchange 2010/2013/2016/Exchange Online (O365)
    • Patch management including experience of one or more of the following: SCCM, WSUS
  • Able to establish credibility with customers
  • Flexibility to contribute to 24x7 obligations and when necessary attend customer site
  • Ability to analyse technical problems and deliver solutions
  • Awareness of ITIL principles




Security Clearance / CRB Clearance

  • Cleared to at least Baseline Personnel Security Standard (BPSS) - AccessNI or equivalent
  • A pre-existing right to work in the UK. Documentary proof will be requested




About Capita IT & Networks

A leading digital infrastructure provider - trusted by thousands of public and private sector enterprises.

Capita IT and Networks is one of the largest IT providers in the UK, providing critical digital, cloud and infrastructure services to over 3,500 organisations. We're the number one provider of IT services to the public sector, supporting one in four hospitals, over 2,500 schools and 50 local councils.

We have top tier partnerships with, and accreditations from, leading technology vendors, including Microsoft, Cisco, DellEMC, AWS and HPE. Our team of over 4,000 people includes 1,000 technical specialists and 250 highly qualified field engineers, providing onsite support to our customers.Customers are also supported by our service desks in Coventry, Belfast and Pune, offering full service management and support 24/7.

We are dedicated to supporting thousands of customers across the UK. From bringing virtual reality into the classroom, to building smart towns and communities, we are passionate about finding new, practical ways to innovate and create better outcomes for our customers. But we are equally passionate about doing the right thing: we want to earn your trust and be the partner you count on every time. We are here for you.


What's in it for you?
  • A competitive basic salary
  • 23 days holiday (rising to 27)
  • Pension, life assurance, holiday buy, a cycle2work scheme…and plenty more
  • Voluntary benefits designed to suit your lifestyle - from retail and socialising, to health & wellbeing and leisure discounts




What we hope you will do next:

Help us find out more about you by completing our short application process - click apply now. We understand you might have some questions before taking the step to apply - you can contact me on Michael Rosbotham on 07864993543 for guidance.

| We Create Better Outcomes |

Capita Resourcing operates as an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of gender identity or gender expression, marital status, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, ethnic origin, nationality, religion or beliefs, disability, age, political opinions or trade union membership.
Apply now

About Capita plc

About Capita IT & Networks

A leading digital infrastructure provider - trusted by thousands of public and private sector enterprises.

Capita IT and Networks is one of the largest IT providers in the UK, providing critical digital, cloud and infrastructure services to over 3,500 organisations. We're the number one provider of IT services to the public sector, supporting one in four hospitals, over 2,500 schools and 50 local councils.

We have top tier partnerships with, and accreditations from, leading technology vendors, including Microsoft, Cisco, DellEMC, AWS and HPE. Our team of over 4,000 people includes 1,000 technical specialists and 250 highly qualified field engineers, providing onsite support to our customers.Customers are also supported by our service desks in Coventry, Belfast and Pune, offering full service management and support 24/7.

We are dedicated to supporting thousands of customers across the UK. From bringing virtual reality into the classroom, to building smart towns and communities, we are passionate about finding new, practical ways to innovate and create better outcomes for our customers. But we are equally passionate about doing the right thing: we want to earn your trust and be the partner you count on every time. We are here for you.

Benefits

  • Flexible working (including home and remote working options)
  • 'Dress for your day' dress code policy
  • Online shopping discounts (incl. retail, health, wellbeing & leisure)
  • Employee Assistance Programme for mental health/wellbeing support
  • Dental and travel insurance
  • Healthcare options (incl. critical illness cover)
  • Company-matched pension scheme and employee share scheme
  • 23 days' holiday plus option to buy up to 5 additional days off
  • Parental leave policy (incl. shared parental leave and carers pay)
  • Discounted travel tickets and hotel stays

items.content:
6 Month Contract to hire

Remote with 50% Travel

Are you a motivated engineer who is passionate about building at scale on Amazon Web Services (AWS) and defining how hundreds of engineers can be productive on AWS. You thrive at simplifying hard problems and can articulate the solution to both technical and non-technical
stakeholders.

You know there are tradeoffs between short-term productivity and long-term vision for the team, while being pragmatic about it. You are an expert in AWS services and Cloud Infrastructure (DNS, Networking, VPC, EC2, Lambda, CloudFormation, Ansible, etc...), are passionate about cloud/infrastructure automation, and closely follow enhancements in the cloud industry.

Responsibilities
Provide technical leadership, deep technology expertise and architecture experience
Provide hands-on technical design and implementation ensuring technologies are successfully incorporated into our environments
Design and define AWS architecture for new cloud computing systems or existing systems migrating to cloud architectures
Perform expert-level systems AWS development and design work that may include logical system design; I/O design; cloud architecture analysis and design; and systems engineering
Write clean, extensible code with appropriate test coverage and documentation
Ensure security is integrated into all cloud architecture solutions.
Develop technical roadmaps for future AWS cloud implementations
Mentor other members of the cloud engineering team

Skills

Required
Advanced knowledge of AWS security/governance/compliance tools
Advanced knowledge on AWS Lambda using python/nodejs
Advanced knowledge on IaC, AWS CloudFormation, HashiCorp Terraform
Advanced knowledge on configuration management tools Ansible, Chef
Advanced knowledge on Kubernetes/AWS EKS and multi-cluster kubernetes management
Advanced knowledge on cloud native CICD tools AWS CodeCommit, CodeBuild, CodeDeploy, CodePipeline
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Preferred
AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate or Professional
AWS Certified DevOps Engineer Professional
Experience in nonrelational databases Cassandra/Solr, AWS DynamoDB
Experience in designing, developing and maintaining PaaS solutions
Experience in designing, developing and maintaining SaaS solutions

Minimum Requirements
Bachelor s degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
The expected length of relevant prior experience beyond formal education is 7 or more years
Verified AWS Certification with validity of 1 year or more

- provided by Dice

The Sr. Network (Integration) Engineer s primary role is to ensure the stability, integrity, and efficient operation of the voice, data, and video systems and infrastructure that support core organizational functions. This is achieved by planning, designing, and developing voice, data, and video solutions across the organization. In addition, the Sr. Network (Integration) Engineer will participate in the installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, and optimization of all voice, data, and video hardware, software, and communication links. Finally, this individual will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate, and resolve issues in order to maximize the benefit of IT systems investments.

The Sr. Network (Design) Engineer s primary role is to conduct/lead research on new and emerging voice, data, and video technologies for practical application to business problems and strategic initiatives. This person also provides technology consultative services to senior management and business members and constantly reviews current voice and data architectures, seeking ways to leverage, improve and/or extend technology investments for the business.
