Top Reasons to Work with Us

Remote and Telecommute opportunity!

Located North of Salt Lake City, is our Technology headquarters in an evolving and growing city called Ogden, UT.

Our organization is well-known for the technology that we create for our clients across the US and through Canada. Our business is mainly focused on the Financial Services end and we create end-user applications to help manage financial products for large organizations.

If you are tired of driving through traffic and into the city but are also looking for the next BIG move in your career, this is the place for you!

Currently, we are looking for a DevOps Engineer that has exposure to Automation DevOps Tools in a Linux open-source environment. Example of technologies: Jenkins, MuleSoft, Kubernetes, ELK, and Docker

Job duties break down as:
50% Sys Admin duties - Maintenance and automation
50% DevOps duties - Using Jenkins automation and close correspondence with Developers

What You Need for this Position

1.) 2+ years as a Systems Administrator/DevOps
2.) Must have Automation experience
3.) Must have Linux Open-Source background
4.) Must have experience using DevOps Tools (ideally, Jenkins)
5.) Must feel comfortable with answering help desk tickets

Bonus skill sets for this role:
1.) Jenkins
2.) Kubernetes
3.) Docker
4.) Ansible
5.) Puppet
6.) Chef
7.) Certifications

Salary ranging from $80,000 - $105,000

It is a team-based position where the successful candidate will be responsible for interacting with clients over the phone, and level 2,3 engineers

Duties include, but are not limited to, the following:

?Troubleshoot office 365 data inconsistencies and issues with onboarding office 365 services by analyzing identity issues in a federated hybrid azure environment; ?Support Office 365 environment, OneDrive, Microsoft SSPR, PIM, and IDM.

?Provide input and participate in cloud identity onboarding processes and workflows; ?Provide end-user Desktop support as it pertains to azure cloud foundry and Office 365 services; ?Utilize PowerShell for troubleshooting and automation of Azure RBAC roles ?Serve as escalation point for any advanced issues and assist team members with resolving customer issues.

?Create Knowledge based documents for new and existing issues encountered during office 365 cloud service deployments.

?Identify technical gaps to operationalize IT support teams and communicate new issues to various teams.

Education and/or Experience:

?Associates, technical school, or bachelor's degree ?Cloud based technology experience, Office 365, One Drive for business, Skype for Business

?2-5 years of IT Infrastructure and maintenance support ?Previous Active Directory administration, DHCP, DNS ?Ability to troubleshoot LAN/WAN routing and connectivity issues ?General knowledge of routing, switching, and firewalls

?2-5 Technical writing experience.

?2-5 years Powershell Experience.

items.title: AWS DevOps- Automation Engineer (Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=13, c=2, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Ready to expand your knowledge and contribute to new ideas pertaining to engineering autonomy? If you have experience in software development and systems operations with AWS DevOps, this could be the job for you. Our qualified employees work to help enterprises develop fundamentally secure services for faster and more consistent software and infrastructure deployments. We are exclusive to AWS and are excited to increase product functionality.

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
We work to provide our customers with the flexibility to be in charge of their own software. By employing industry leading continuous delivery patterns and collaboratively working with other members to execute them, we help our clients to achieve successful solutions. We also collaboratively work with Senior DevOps Automation Engineers to assist and empower customers to come up with self-service solutions and create better outcomes

BENEFITS
We understand the importance of a work-life balance, which is why we allow our employees to work anywhere with available internet connection. Outside of any core working hours, you could be working from home, the beach, outer space or a coworking space. We value your career goals, as well as our customer's goals, and are happy to allow employees an unlimited amount of PTO. Employees are part of a large distributed remote team. In order to insure you'll never feel alone, we provide employees the tools to stay in touch and collaborate with colleagues, whether that's through simple meetings or a pair programming exercise.
  • Work from home
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Flexible schedule
  • Continuous learning opportunities
  • Part of a large distributed remote team
SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS
  • 4+ years of technical experience in either development, operations, or full-stack implementations
  • Demonstrated programming capability in programming languages such as Ruby, Python, Java, C#, etc.
  • Successful customer engagements providing continuous delivery solutions, preferably employing AWS
  • Demonstrated Linux or Windows command-line capability
  • Familiar with core suite of AWS Services related to DevOps, with particular depth in CloudFormation, OpsWorks and IAM
  • Experience establishing and employing Continuous Integration practices and tools such as Jenkins or other CI tools
  • Frequent and comfortable use of configuration management automation tools such as Chef (or other such tools) in creating continuous delivery systems
  • Preferred AWS Certified Associate (Solutions Architect, Sys Ops, Developer).
AWS DevOps- Automation Engineer

items.content:
DevOps Engineer
Working under the supervision of a team lead, the DevOps Engineer participates in a distributed team of managed services consultants, and software engineers responsible for designing, developing, updating and supporting commerce and service-based software systems. This position is expected to be an integral part of a consulting team, competent to work on software setup, configuration, scripting in support of a managed services based continuous integration environment.
Location
The ideal candidate will be local to our Headquarters office and able to work at the office as requested. The ideal candidate will also be able to travel to on site visits with clients if requested. Local in-office and REMOTE opportunities are available. Company is headquartered in El Segundo, CA.
Responsibilities
The DevOps Engineer helps to create technical solutions with emphasis on CMS and eCommerce applications housed in Azure, and other cloud service providers. This role collaborates extensively with teams of consultants in creating cutting edge Commerce, mobile and cloud solutions. In addition to basic technical / programming skills, a successful candidate can assist in translating conceptual ideas into concrete tasks as well as assist in translating business needs into technical requirements.
Qualifications
  • 2+ years of experience with the Azure platform; Visual Studio Team Services, Azure IaaS offerings, Azure PaaS offerings, Azure Portal, Power Shell, Azure Resource Manager, and/or Application Insights
  • Experience with MS Azure Web Apps, ARM templates and Azure SQL
  • Release automation (e.g. Jenkins, Team City, Octopus, Azure DevOps), system administration, system configuration, and system debugging experience.
  • Experience installing and maintaining Microsoft database servers / services.
  • Experience using configuration management tools (Chef, Puppet, Ansible, etc.) and command execution frameworks, Power Shell, etc.
  • Experience managing source control/repositories (Git, GitHub, TFS)
  • Knowledge of automated code review and testing tools (e.g. SonarQube)
  • Experience in 24x7 production operations, preferably supporting a highly available environment for a SaaS or cloud service provider.
  • Knowledge of browser automation (Selenium and Selenium WebDriver)
  • Knowledge of workflow tools (e.g. Atlassian).
  • Experience with .NET CMS and Commerce (in DevOps role) preferred
Experience:
  • Azure Platform: 2 years (Required)
  • Azure DevOps (VSTS): 2 years (Required)
  • Power Shell: 2 years (Required)
  • ARM/Terra-form: 2 years (Required)
  • Azure App Services: 2 years (Required)
  • Service Fabric/Docker: 2 years (Bonus)
Education:
  • Bachelor's (Preferred)
